long_description: Set within a boutique modern development within the heart of London this impressive sixth floor, one bedroom apartment is located moments from Fleet Street, The Strand, Covent Garden with Temple, Chancery Lane and Holborn underground stations all a short walk away. This impressive apartment offers luxury modern living within the heart of London with access to tranquil private gardens and 24hr concierge. Located on the sixth floor the apartment comprises entrance hall with deep storage, impressive reception room with balcony, fitted kitchen with stone work tops, integrated appliances and fitted cabinets, generous double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, balcony and shower room. Residents of this fantastic boutique development have the benefit of close proximity to numerous underground stations, Fleet Street and Covent Garden.

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with JLL The Cadogan is a stunning three-bedroom apartment set over 1,770 sq ft of internal floor area.   The Westin Residences by Marriot is a collection of 9 three-bedroom contemporary residences located in historic Queenhithe dock with a protected Thames view. The nine residences take design inspiration from the river with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows maximising the light reflecting off the ebbing and flowing water.  To make the most of this unique view, each apartment includes a riverside balcony, the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the comings and goings on the water.  Each of The Residences interiors reflect the natural textures of the riverbed, with bespoke dark oak carpentry lifted by the light pouring into the spacious rooms. Kitchens are bespoke Italian design, with high quality Gaggenau white goods and Quooker taps.  While separate from The Westin Hotel by Marriot, ensuring privacy, the nine apartments will have direct and private access through to the hotel’s facilities. These include over 3,500 sq ft of spa and wellness facilities, incorporating a swimming pool, exercise studios, TRX workout space and therapy rooms in addition to The Signature Restaurant and The Riverside Bar.  Despite the boutique nature of The Residences, peace of mind and ease of living is ensured through a full concierge and valet service provided by the hotel. Residents will benefit from the convenience and attention one expects from a five-star hotel, combined with all the comforts of home.  Enquire now for more information about your new home. Brochures The Westin Residences- Brochure.pdf

long_description: *Click the link for a Virtual Tour!* Looking for a unique triple-aspect Central London apartment in the heart of the historic Chancery Lane area – with garden views from a total of 6 private balconies? This immaculately presented 1st-floor flat comes with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (including an en-suite), underfloor heating throughout, and staggering architectural views of the nearby Maughan Library from the north, northwest, and west-facing balconies in the living room and both bedrooms. As you step through onto the engineered timber floor of your new entrance hall, you'll find two large integrated storage/utility areas tucked away on your left, neatly enclosed by two sets of double doors finished in luxurious engineered veneer. To your right, you'll find the master bedroom, complete with an extra-wide triple set of sliding wardrobe doors, a north-facing wooden-decked balcony behind a set of French windows, and its own private en-suite bathroom (including a heated towel rail, a mirrored vanity unit with integrated lighting, and a glass-door, walk-in shower enclosure – all of it beautifully finished with porcelain tiling on the walls and floor). As you explore further down the hallway, you'll come to the second bedroom on your right, with its own similar north-facing balcony views. Across from the second bedroom, you'll find the main family bathroom, complete with a heated towel rail, a mirrored vanity unit with integrated lighting, and a glass-screen, rain-style shower over a modern white bath with a unique reclining shape. Through the door at the end of the hallway, this beautiful Central London apartment opens out into a bright and spacious dual-aspect living, dining, and kitchen area, with a total of four private balconies spanning two walls of the room. With three balconies running along the expansive northwestern wall, it's the perfect place to capture the relaxing afternoon light from the setting sun – or simply to admire the view of the private residents' gardens below and the impressive architecture of the Grade II-listed library enclosing the gardens. To your left, you'll find a fully equipped corner kitchen, with bespoke, LED-lit cabinetry over polished composite stone worktops with glass splash backs, an integrated extractor hood, an integrated full-height fridge-freezer, a wine cooler, and a full range of Siemens appliances (including a 4-zone induction hob, a stainless steel oven with black glass, and a stainless steel microwave). Beyond the walls of this charming luxury apartment, you'll be a member of the St. Dunstan's House community, with all of the amenities that entails. As a resident of St. Dunstan's House, you'll have exclusive access to: * The Private Landscaped Gardens * A Communal Club Area * A 24-hour Concierge * 24-hour CCTV coverage * And Secure Bike Storage (with options for additional storage). You'll be just a 7-minute walk from Chancery Lane Tube Station, giving you quick links to the shops at Oxford Street, or to the cross-country trains at Liverpool Street Station – and you'll be just a 7-minute walk away from the Thames, giving you easy access to riverside walks along Blackfriars Bridge and further afield to the South Bank. This bright and spacious Central London 2-bed comes with landscaped garden views, immaculate interiors, and plenty of natural light from its six private balconies. And that means a gorgeous apartment like this one won't be on the market for long. So if you're looking for a luxury new home in the heart of the historic Chancery Lane area – with the Tube and the river just a short walk away – give us a call and we'll show you everything life at St. Dunstan's House has to offer.

bullet_points: 6,505sq.ft With 12 ft ceilings on the ground floor;Freehold tenure;Three floors of office space;One-bed apartment;Private roof terrace and rear garden;Electronically controlled security gate to a front courtyard;Parking for multiple cars;Close to Barbican and The City
long_description: A rare opportunity to acquire an exceptional 10,620sq ft  freehold site in an incredible position nestled between the Barbican and Smithfield Market. The property features 6.505sq ft recently renovated building set in a charming private garden and has a 1,076sq ft roof terrace. It is currently configured with a spacious one-bedroom apartment on the first floor and commercial offices occupying the remaining floors. This building has been renovated to an exceptional standard by internationally renowned designer Jan Wilson (BCFA Lifetime Achievement Award, 2016). It has a broad appeal, and will be of especial interest to buyers wishing to run their business from home, continue to use it as a commercial building or apply for a change of use to wholly residential. The property is extremely secure with the private front courtyard providing off-street parking for a number of cars. The first-floor apartment is spacious, well-appointed and in excellent decorative condition and benefits from a wonderful roof terrace, as well as a charming rear garden accessed by stairs or via the ground floor. The property occupies a strategic but secluded position behind Charterhouse Square and is accessed from Aldersgate Street. Barbican underground station and the new Elizabeth Line at Farringdon are a seven-minute walk away. The building is within easy walking distance to the excellent shops, restaurants, bars and entertainment of the City, Clerkenwell and Farringdon. Brochures Web Details

long_description: Extremely bright and spacious studio flat now available, moments from LSE and the Inns of Court. This modern apartment is located in a secure, portered block in a desirable location close to the City of London and Holborn with Central line and Piccadilly line connections.  It has been newly refurbished throughout with wooden flooring, repainted with modern blinds on all windows. The large double glazed windows allow floods of natural light into the space with views onto an historic church, high up on third floor with no neighbours compromising privacy. A rare opportunity for a pied a terre or quiet modern home for one in central London. Clifford's Inn itself was once named the 'Inns of Chancery' and dates back to 1344 when Law in the City of London was taught by the Clergy, past students include barrister Edward Coke and Jurist John Seldon. Residences at Clifford's Inn have been home to famed writer Virginia Woolf, former Lord Mayor Sir John Stuttard and High Court Judge Sir Ernest Ryder. The area itself has seen much change in recent years with many residential developments appearing and within such close proximity to both the City and London's West End, it is easy to see why. Fetter Lane is located within the City of London's ward of Farringdon without and is moments from bars, restaurants and retail, the area is ideal for any purchaser hoping to find a weekday base in London or an excellent buy-to-let investment The property is conveniently positioned between Chancery Lane, Temple and Blackfriars underground stations and City Thameslink station is within 10 minutes walk of the property. Council Tax band D

long_description: One Bishopsgate Plaza offers a range of luxury one, two and three bedroom apartments above the first Pan Pacific Hotel in Europe and just steps from Liverpool Street station. All 160 apartments, which form the Sky Residences, are uniquely positioned on levels 21 to 41 to ensure every home has unparalleled views of the city and beyond. Many of the apartments feature double aspect and full-height glazing to provide residents a home in the sky. Residents will benefit from the gracious Asian hospitality of the Pan Pacific London in a world-class City location. In addition to private residential amenities, Europe's first Pan Pacific hotel will offer residents exclusive access to its five-star amenities, designed by internationally renowned Yabu Pushelberg. One Bishopsgate Plaza is situated in one of The City's most desirable locations, with an established lifestyle offering on its doorstep - At the heart of the Square Mile in The City's cluster of tall buildings Central City of London location,Liverpool Street Underground Station is a two-minute walk away, enabling fast connection to the Eurostar (11 mins), London City Airport (27 mins) and Heathrow (35 mins) Five of London's major hubs are accessible within 15 minutes of Liverpool Street Station - King's Cross St Pancras, Oxford Circus, Bond Street station, London Bridge and Farringdon Queen Mary's University, University of the Arts London and London School of Economics are all within 20 minutes of the development

long_description: The expansive, dual-aspect, open-plan living area offers a bright and spacious area, perfect for entertaining. The bespoke kitchen suite boasts top of the range Miele integrated appliances with a stylish, stone breakfast bar. Natural, engineered oak flooring runs throughout this impressive space.  The two, large bedrooms sit at either end of the living area. The interiors are contemporary in design with bespoke fitted wardrobes and finished with beautiful bronze ironmongery and luxurious carpets.  The master bedroom boasts a beautiful en-suite with a walk-in shower. The luxurious family bathroom is fitted with beautiful hand-picked marble slabs, and features polished nickel taps and underfloor heating for the ultimate luxury experience.  Pinks Mews at Dyers Buildings is a secluded development in the heart of Holborn EC1. Tucked away, in a gated environment, offering a rare tranquil retreat from the bustling capital city, stands six beautiful Victorian buildings set around a central courtyard. With private entrances, dedicated lifts and a 24-hour concierge, the development follows a design vision and specification unheard of outside Mayfair, Knightsbridge and Belgravia.  Pinks Mews is surrounded by a multitude of amenities; first-class restaurants, luxury hotels and boutique designers are all within walking distance of the Mews, including: Roka, Brasserie Blanc, The Rosewood Hotel, Charles Tyrwhitt, and Arlington and Co. This mews is in a primary location, with underground stations within close proximity, Chancery Lane Station (0.1 miles – Central line), Farringdon Station (Thameslink, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines), and Holborn Station (0.5 miles – Central and Piccadilly lines)  CBRE Limited on its behalf and for the Vendors or Lessors of this property whose Agents they are, give notice that: 1. long_description: Exceptionally rare one of only 12 Barbican Type 100 Penthouses, Seventh Floor with large and bright reception room, double sliding doors to DOUBLE balcony, which extends outside of the bedroom, second internal room could be spare bedroom/study. Extra large main bedroom, wide hallway. Original Brooke Marine Kitchen & original Bathroom. North and East facing in need of refurbishment.  Underfloor heating throughout included in the service charge. Lift. Built in 1971, the Barbican Estate is the finest achievement of the architects Chamberlin, Powell & Bon. The architects drew inspiration from Le Corbusier, famous for being one of the pioneers of what now is called Modern architecture. Their vision has created a unique urban village community devoid of traffic with immediate amenities including the Barbican Arts Centre, a church, school, library and shops. The estate was Grade II-listed in 2001 in recognition of its extraordinary contribution to London's urban landscape. Barbican tube station (on the Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines) is only a couple of minutes' walk away, with Moorgate (on the Northern line), St Paul's (on the Central line) and Mansion House (on the District line) tube stations each within a short walking distance. Moments walking distance the new Elizabeth Station Farringdon Station. This entrance will provide access to the 'East Ticket Hall' linking directly with the existing London Underground platforms at Barbican & Farringdon Stations therefore providing access to the Metropolitan, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines. On completion in 2022 Farringdon Station will be a vital interchange between the North-South Thameslink and the East-West Crossrail service. 140 trains per hour will travel through the station. Elizabeth Line will give direct access to Canary Wharf in 9 minutes & Bond Street in 3 minutes. Tik Tok have just taken the whole building above as its new European Headquarters Waitrose is located nearby on Whitecross Street, which is also home to the weekday Whitecross Street food market. Next door to the Barbican is West Smithfield an area that has seen a huge regeneration, incoming occupiers are small food outlets, coffee shops bars & restaurants providing a buzzing mixed use location. Comprising of many media, digital and creative industries, but increasingly legal, professional and finance. The Museum of London will move to Smithfield Market in 2024. Smithfield Meat Market will be vacated ( date to be announced) then it are will be transformed into a world beating food & gastro destination and will be part of the world beating Cultural Mile.   Brochures 6-Page Landscape

long_description: Luxury two-bedroom authentic loft apartment in the City of London. The Tapestry Building sits on the edge of Devonshire Square, adjacent to Liverpool Street Station. Originally built in 18th Century by the East India Company, this imposing building was converted into 14 contemporary warehouse apartments that offer unrivalled space and specification.  The building is access through a discreet entrance serving this section of the development with only one apartment per floor. The apartment offers a spectacular 27ft reception with very high ceilings providing a fantastic volume which is unusual to find in Central London. There are two spacious double bedrooms and two bathrooms appointed to the highest specification. Accommodation is complete with the utility room and plenty of built in storage. Features include from comfort cooling, luxury Gaggenau fitted kitchen, and bespoke joinery through-out, to the under-floor heating and intelligent lighting, these light and airy apartments offer luxurious modern living right in the heart of the City.  The location offers excellent transport links with Liverpool Street underground (Central, Circle, Hammersmith and City and Metropolitan Lines) and rail station one minute walk from the property. The opening of Crossrail next year will also provide direct fast trains across London. Lease length 125 years (less 1 day) from 20 July 2007

Overlooking the inside building, Landmark Place holds an unparalleled position as the only residential waterfront development in the City of London. These exquisite residences, coupled with world-class resident amenities, represent a once-in-a-lifetime.  The open-plan reception room, dining room and an Italian-made kitchen have been designed and installed to the highest standard offering a modern and minimal look, ideal for entertaining.

bullet_points: A collection of 9 three-bedroom contemporary residences.;Each apartment includes a riverside balcony.;Kitchens are bespoke Italian design, with high quality Gaggenau white goods and Quooker taps.;Direct and private access through to the hotel’s facilities.;Full concierge and valet service provided by the hotel.

long_description: The Westcroft is a stunning three-bedroom apartment on the 7th floor of the Westin Residences set over 2,893 sq ft of internal floor area.   The Westin Residences by Marriot is a collection of 9 three-bedroom contemporary residences located in historic Queenhithe dock with a protected Thames view. The nine residences take design inspiration from the river with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows maximising the light reflecting off the ebbing and flowing water.  To make the most of this unique view, each apartment includes a riverside balcony, the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the comings and goings on the water.  Each of The Residences interiors reflect the natural textures of the riverbed, with bespoke dark oak carpentry lifted by the light pouring into the spacious rooms. Kitchens are bespoke Italian design, with high quality Gaggenau white goods and Quooker taps.  While separate from The Westin Hotel by Marriot, ensuring privacy, the nine apartments will have direct and private access through to the hotel’s facilities. These include over 3,500 sq ft of spa and wellness facilities, incorporating a swimming pool, exercise studios, TRX workout space and therapy rooms in addition to The Signature Restaurant and The Riverside Bar.  Despite the boutique nature of The Residences, peace of mind and ease of living is ensured through a full concierge and valet service provided by the hotel. Residents will benefit from the convenience and attention one expects from a five-star hotel, combined with all the comforts of home.  Enquire now for more information about your new home. Brochures The Westin Residences- Brochure.pdf

long_description: A prime river fronted penthouse with spectacular views out across the river Thames, the Southbank and the Savoy Embankment. Sir John Lyon House is an award winning, ultra-modern residential development located on the North side of the river in the heart of the City of London. The apartment comprises three double bedrooms, two of which are ensuite. The master bedroom faces out directly onto the Thames with floor to ceiling windows.   The reception room is a vast open-plan living space with floor to ceiling windows and a Juliet balcony offering unrestricted views of some of London’s great landmarks including the Tate Modern, river Thames and millennium bridge. This vast area personifies exactly what a penthouse’s entertaining space should be. Surrounding area highlights include The Shard, St Paul’s Cathedral, the City Skyline and Shad Thames. There is a boutique designed glass staircase leading up to a roof terrace offering 360-degree views. The apartment exceeds 1,600 square feet of internal accommodation of which all is utilised as usable living area.   Sir John Lyon House benefits from a concierge, lift access, a communal terrace area and its own private secure garage. The development is located close to all the amenities that the City of London has to offer, Mansion House station, Blackfriars station and the ever-evolving Southbank. Brochures Particulars

long_description: ** BUY TO LET INVESTORS** Pink Mews is a luxury gated mews development that inherits its name from the mews' original use for dying fabrics for the Royal Hunter's tailcoats known as 'hunting pinks'.  This stunning two-bedroom, first-floor apartment has been beautifully designed boasting a spacious dual aspect living space that flows seamlessly into a high spec open-plan kitchen and dining area. The spacious bedroom has been designed for comfort, with an en-suite shower room, separate from the guest cloakroom located in the hall.  The apartment is equipped with built-in (Sonos) audio systems, as well as panel-controlled underfloor heating, lighting, and air-conditioning, very much defining the apartment as a 'Smart Home'.  Residents of this quiet mews also benefit from a personal concierge service available 24 hours.

bullet_points: 2273 Sq Ft;Six Storey Modern House;Four Bedrooms;Three Bathrooms;Internal Garage and Parking;Two Floors Of Living Space;Private Terrace;Internally Re-Designed By 'Inside Out' Architects;Service Charge- £1219 pa;Ground Rent- Peppercorn
long_description: Monkwell Square is set back from London Wall right in the heart of the City, part of a private terrace of just four houses designed by Sir Terry Farrell overlooking a peaceful square with the landscaped grounds incorporating part of the Roman London Wall.  This six storey home has been thoughtfully designed for modern living, benefitting from an entire internal renovation overseen by interior architects 'Inside Out' several years ago. There are two floors of living space, with a Baulthaup kitchen and dining room looking on to the reception room below via a glass atrium ensuring this ideal family space also serves well for socialising.  An integral garage provides storage or parking in addition to a private parking space externally with a utility room accessed via the rear of the garage. A guest W.C and impressive entrance lobby completes the ground floor.  The upper levels are occupied by four bedrooms, with the principle suite featuring both a walk through dressing room and en-suite. The top floor has been remodelled to include a mezzanine bedroom level, above a perfect setting for a home office/study, with a private terrace providing roof top views across the square with The Barbican in the backdrop. Situation Local schools include St Paul's Cathedral School, City of London School for Girls within the Barbican and the City of London School for Boys at St Paul’s; there is also an abundance of nursery school options nearby.  Transport links include over ground and underground services from Farringdon station along with the new Elizabeth Line (Crossrail) due in 2021, the Central line at St Paul’s, Circle and Hammersmith & City lines at Barbican (24-hour service at the weekends) and Northern Line at Moorgate.  Asides from the Barbican, with its theatres, music hall and cinema there are many institutions throughout the City and a fine range of eateries nearby including The Ned (nine restaurants and a private members club). A Waitrose on Whitecross St or Marks & Spencer at Moorgate provide local shopping with further retail, clothing and food stores at One New Change. At Bishopsgate is the new exclusive Equinox Health Club with multiple Virgin Active clubs also nearby. Brochures Particulars

long_description: A stunning duplex apartment in Holborn.  Description A fully renovated duplex apartment with a private terrace.  Bream's buildings is a prestigious development with an attractive period façade, located in a peaceful street with no through traffic.  The apartment is beautifully finished with a recently appointed kitchen and bathroom suite. On the ground floor is the kitchen and a sizeable dual aspect lounge. On the lower level is a generous principle bedroom, an additional bedroom/office, bathroom and access to a private courtyard. Offered chain free. Location Conveniently positioned between the City of London and West End. Chancery Lane Tube Station is approximately 260 yards and Farringdon Tube is approximately 700 yards.  A few minutes West is the open space of Lincoln's Inn Fields and the site of the London School of economics. The area is particular noted for its links to the legal profession. long_description: Barts Square is a vibrant new Residential Quarter in the heart of historic Smithfield.  The development houses a mix of contemporary architecture and characterful restoration.  Description The final phase at Barts Square will bring a range of contemporary new residences whilst respectfully maintaining the areas historic streetscape with careful design.   Set across 3 buildings, each with its own distinct design and personality, Phase 2 arguably offers the best views within the scheme.  With apartments looking towards the domes of St Paul's and Old Bailey, the historic courtyards of St Bartholomew Church or the beautiful Grade II listed St Barts Hospital, there is something for everyone.  The three buildings comprise of 92 new residential residences with a mix of studios, one, two, three bedroom and Penthouse apartments available. Residents will benefit from a range of intimate and elegant amenities including a residents’ lounge, residents’ bar, private dining and meeting rooms and a private cinema room. Location On the doorstep of The City, St Pauls, Crossrail’s Farringdon Station and the ever popular Clerkenwell, the scheme offers the perfect balance of new and old, village life and city living, exclusivity and accessibility. The development is the only residential offering of its kind in the square mile and is perfectly positioned for all that life in the City has to offer; St Paul’s, the Barbican and Museum of London are all moments away. The neighbourhood offers a wealth of restaurants and bars, from the street food of Exmouth Market and Whitecross Street to the fine dining of Club Gascon, Hix and St John’s, every taste is catered for. Square Footage: 1,090 sq ft Leasehold with approximately 995 years remaining. Brochures Web Details

long_description: This stunning home is well presented and finished to a high standard throughout. The kitchen is perfect for modern lifestyles and benefits from plenty of storage from the base and wall-mounted units. The living room has plenty of natural light and is great for spending quality time with friends and family or enjoying individual pursuits. The home also benefits from a separate dining room. The conservatory is perfect for enjoying the warmer weather and offers further options for entertaining. Upstairs, there are four good-sized bedrooms all with plenty of space for additional furniture. The bathroom is modern and consists of a four-piece suite with a bath and separate walk-in shower. The home has a  large rear enclosed garden with a paved area, great for barbeques, and a safe space for children to play! The home has a garage as well as driveway parking. There is an array of amenities including shops, bars, eateries, supermarkets, and green spaces. Viewings here are a must! Tenure: Freehold Council Tax: F

long_description: ** Launch Day - Saturday 25th June ** A beautifully presented, three bedroom, two bathroom semi-detached family home set within easy reach of several transport links and numerous well-regarded schools, including Cheam Park Farm Primary Academy, St Cecilia’s Catholic Primary School and Glenthorne High School.  Accommodation to the ground floor consists of a front aspect living room, an open-plan kitchen/dining room, plenty of storage and a downstairs WC.  On the first floor, the property offers two double bedrooms and the family bathroom.  On the second floor, you will find the Principal bedroom and an en-suite shower room.  Outside, the property offers a well-maintained rear garden, laid to lawn with patio area. Towards the end of the lawn there is an office/studio that the current owners use as a games room that would also be ideal for working from home. To the front of the property, a driveway provides ample off street parking. Brochures Web Details Particulars

bullet_points: - Five bedrooms;- South Wallington;- Modern Interior;- Off Street Parking;- Excellent local schooling;- Spacious Interior;- Wide Frontage;- Three Bathrooms
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Fine & Country Three floors await providing five bedrooms, three bath/shower room, two reception rooms all within this detached family residence which is approached via a sweeping in & out driveway. The superb finish is immediately evident; from the spacious reception hall and continuing beyond the ground floor. Two reception rooms are found before the exquisite modern kitchen which has been recently modernised to maximise natural light. The flow between rooms is excellent and natural.  The Upper floors provide spacious accommodation for growing families. Double bedrooms, host of bathrooms and lots of storage characterise the upper floors. The property is located in a quiet sought after residential road, within easy reach of Wallington & Purley Town centres, with Wallington and Purley station serving London Bridge, Victoria and Clapham Junction within 20 minutes plus. Both Sutton and Banstead town centres are also within a short drive.  There is a good selection of state and private schools including, Wallington Girls which is within walking distance, with Wilsons, The John Fisher Wallington Grammar, Cumnor House, Whitgift School and Croydon High for Girls, all within a short distance. Wallington offers a choice of nearby sports facilities including a David Lloyd Club and the locally respected Purley Sports Club with its array of sports facilities including tennis, squash, bowls, hockey and cricket. There is easy access by car to the M25, M23, Gatwick and Heathrow Airports, making this a superb location for any commute. All in all a superb house in a very popular location surrounded by some of Surrey's finest open green belt countryside and fine walks and where sporting pursuits such as golf and horse riding can be enjoyed. bullet_points: 4 Bedrooms;Living Room;Dining Room;Kitchen;Breakfast Room;Conservatory;Utility Room;Two Ground Floor WC;Family Bathroom;Separate Upstairs WC
long_description: ** Launch Day - Saturday 18th June ** Viewing by appointment only  Situated in one of the area’s most sought after roads, this detached house offers huge potential for any new owner to extend, renovate or re-build (stpp) to create a superb family home in the heart of South Cheam.  The property is situated within walking distance of Cheam Village with its extensive range of shops and restaurants plus its mainline station offering services into central London.  Local schools are highly regarded and include Nonsuch High School for Girls. The accommodation as it stands is substantial and comprises, on the ground floor, a spacious reception hall, two large main reception rooms, kitchen with adjacent breakfast room, utility room, conservatory and two cloakrooms.  Upstairs there are four double bedrooms, a family bathroom and separate WC. Outside to the front there is a carriage driveway leading to the garage and providing off street parking for several cars.  The rear garden is a very good size extending to approx. 150ft and offers a large expanse of lawn surrounded by mature trees and shrubs. The property offers substantial scope for improvement and extension, subject to the usual planning consents. Brochures Web Details Particulars

bullet_points: Guide Price £375,000 - £400,000;Located Near To A Plethora Of Local Amenities;Excellent Transport Links;Private Parking Space;Spacious Bedrooms;Walking Distance To Open Green Spaces;Views 7 Days A Week!;Walking Distance To Sutton Station
long_description: Guide Price £375,000 - £400,000.  Laurels are delighted to bring to the market this stunning, two bedroom, ground floor apartment that is situated on a popular residential road in Sutton. This property is located within walking distance to Sutton Station (Zone 5 – Southern and Thameslink trains to London Bridge) as well as brilliant local bus routes.  This delightful property offers a spacious living/dining area, boasting a bright and contemporary lounging area which is the perfect spot for entertaining. The kitchen features an open plan layout with integrated appliances and a modern finish. Internal accommodation is finished off with a main double-bedroom with accompanying en-suite bathroom, second well-sized double-bedroom and shared family shower room.  Further benefits of this property include immaculate finish throughout, close proximity to transport links, a number of outstanding local schools as well as a plethora of amenities such as cafes, shops and restaurants. The property also offers one allocated parking space.  The local authority is Sutton London Borough Council, with a council tax band of D. The EPC rating is C. Early viewings are highly recommended, and viewings can be accommodated seven days a week including bank holidays! Brochures Full Details

bullet_points: Four Bedrooms;Detached;Sought After Location;Close to Sutton Train Station;Immaculate Interior;Five Reception Rooms
long_description: Even if you know the area its possible you would know this small cul-de-sac, tucked away and within 10 minutes walk of Sutton train station and Harris academy catchment. Once discovered, the location opens up all the very best of South Sutton and Carshalton Beeches.    Approaching the house, its immediately evident the house is well kept and manicured; the handsome frontage is a strong foundation for any home. The driveway offers several off-street parking spaces , Electrical Vehicle charger and accesses the storm porch and entrance door. Internally, the house has been decorated with style and provides a cool and sophisticated interior. The accommodation includes, four bedrooms, two bathrooms, five reception rooms, kitchen, large entrance hall and cloakroom. The layout is easy to use, and the recent addition of the extra lounge brings an airiness and flow which isn’t seen in many other houses. Additionally, the ability to have a mix of open plan and separation is vital for any home with growing children.    As any well-rounded house should be, this home connects the indoors with the outdoors and is ideal for entertaining. The large glass access door to both gardens frames each view and provide the bridge to each space. To one side of the house, the exceptional sun terrace with fireplace, adorned with lavender hedges, and to the other side the green lawn and mature shrubs: ideal for football, cricket or just lounging in private.    Sutton is a bustling and vibrant Greater London town. Fast train connections in both directions, Central London and the South, easy access to strong road connections including the A3 and M25. A high street which serves most needs and includes a cinema, numerous restaurants, department stores and other shops. Excellent schooling to include both state and public schools and a host of sporting facilities.    In summary this is a move in and enjoy option. Providing an ultra convenient location and excellent local amenities, the addition of a sensational interior is a very attractive offering. We highly recommend your interest and encourage you to view.    - Four bedrooms   - Detached   - Ultra Convenient Location   - Immaculate Interior  - Off Street Parking    - Landscaped Gardens   - Five Reception Rooms   - Close to Sutton Train Station      IMPORTANT NOTE TO PURCHASERS:  We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. long_description: SUMMARY A most impressive & beautifully presented five/six bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a well-regarded location close to a lovely park and great schools. DESCRIPTION A most impressive & beautifully presented five/six bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a well-regarded location close to a lovely park and great schools. This stunning house has been skilfully extended and offers generous & versatile living space with a beautiful kitchen/breakfast room and a secluded rear garden. Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to Waterloo in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both of London's Airports. Bus services run to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. The attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Nandos, Costa, Cafe Nero, Starbucks, Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents. There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to the area's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks. 1. bullet_points: Split Level Apartment;Two Double Bedrooms;Spacious Lounge;Refitted Kitchen;Refitted Bathroom;Private Garden;Backing Cuddington Park;Walk to Shops, Schools & Station
long_description: Occupying an enviable position backing onto Cuddington Park and within walking distance of local schools, shops and Worcester Park/Stoneleigh railway station is this truly stunning, split level maisonette. The property has been refurbished to a high standard by its current owners and offers a spacious lounge / dining room with build I speaker system, which is open plan to a refitted kitchen.  The Master bedroom is a good sized double room with a view of the Park and a range of fitted wardrobes. Also off the large hallway is a modern and stylish bathroom with separate bath and shower, electric underfloor heating and built in speak system.  The top floor is occupied by a further double bedroom with an even further reaching view of the park behind. To the front of  the property is a driveway, and to the rear a fantastic West facing private garden with separate lawned and decked areas. There is also a large outbuilding which also houses a build in bar with the addition of having internet supplied to it and a gate to the park behind. Early viewing highly recommended by sole agents. Worcester Park and Stoneleigh offers a larger choice of amenities including a Waitrose, banks/building societies and other essential stores, as well as a variety of restaurants, Worcester Park also offers great access to public transport.  The property is within walking distance of both Stoneleigh and Worcester Park mainline rail station with regular services to London and both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible, giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports.  There are also local bus routes nearby giving convenient access to Morden underground making this property ideal for commuters. long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 101 years remaining The Property Purplebricks are delighted to offer this lovely recently redecorated, CHAIN FREE,  two double bedroom GROUND FLOOR apartment for the over 55's to the market. The property is located inside a well run development 0.4 miles away from the High St in Wallington SM6. From the car park , where you have your own private parking space, you enter the principle building whereupon you find a lovely residents lounge and well maintained communal areas.  The apartment is a short walk away from the social areas on the ground floor. As you enter the apartment, you find a large entrance hallway which is wheelchair accessible and which has a storage cupboard for your coats, hats and shoes. Turning right you find the two very good sized double bedrooms, the master measuring 16'1 x 9'3 which has built in wardrobes and the second double room offering 10'4 x 8'8. The main lounge again is a light and bright space which is quasi-open planned onto the kitchen . ALL THE MAIN ROOMS ARE SET UP LATERALLY AND HAVE VIEWS OUT ONTO GREEN AREAS. Finally you find the well appointed three piece bathroom with 'walk in' double shower (previously held a bath tub). Outside - The property has  parking spaces available and there are well maintained communal gardens surrounding the property. Lease - 101 years remaining. Service Charges - £1714.93 every 6 months. Laundry Room No water rates* On site Assistance Location The property is located 0.4 miles from Wallington train station which has links into London Bridge, London Victoria, Sutton & West Croydon. There are bus links a short walk away to Wallington & Croydon and Wallington High street is within walking distance and has a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. This really is a lovely apartments set within a well maintained and managed development and we look forward to showing you around. ***** VIEWING BY APPOINTNMENT ONLY ***** Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. bullet_points: No Onward Chain;Two Double Bedroom Flat;5Th Floor Corner Flat With Large Private Balcony;0.4 Miles To Sutton Common Train Station;Lease - 99 Years Remaining;Spacious Kitchen-Living Room;En-Suite To Master Bedroom;High-Spec Fitted Kitchen;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Families;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 99 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain. Two double bedroom fifth floor corner flat with spacious open plan kitchen-living room, private balcony, en-suite to master bedroom, 99 year lease and within moment of Sutton town center making it an ideal property for 1st time buyers & young families. There is a secure communal entrance with both lift access and stairs leading up to the fifth floor. The property has an entrance hallway with storage space to one side leading through to the kitchen-living room area. The fitted kitchen has an integrated electric hob, fan oven, dishwasher, fridge-freezer and Quooker Tap (instant boiling water tap/ filter water). The living room area has space for a dining table & chairs, lounge area with custom made John Lewis curtains and there are doors leading out to the private patio with space for seating. There are two double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefitting from build in wardrobes to one side and it also has an en-suite shower room with walk-in shower, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. The family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. The property is located on the 5th floor which means there are no properties above and only one neighbouring property on the same floor making it a very quiet location. The property has been recently decorated throughout at the end of 2021. The sellers have also stated they are happy to leave all of the curtains and blinds in the property. Lease - 99 years remaining. Location The property is located 0.4 miles from Sutton Common train station which has links into London Blackfriars, London Bridge & Wimbledon. Sutton train station is 0.6 miles away and has links into London Victoria, Epsom & West Croydon. For primary schools, Robin Hood Junior School is 0.2 miles away and All Saints Benhilton CofE Primary School is within 0.3 miles. For secondary schools, Sutton Grammar School is within 0.3 miles and Greenshaw High School is 0.8 miles away. Sutton town centre is moments away offering a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages, the property is located next to a large Sainsburys supermarket. The incredible volume of a disused space at the foot of Barbican’s Cromwell Tower offers the rarest of opportunities to create one of London’s finest architectural homes. The Void Space is a single four-storey unit of over 30 ft in height and 65 ft in length, with a wonderful structural composition of varying exposed concrete finishes. A superb design developed by renowned architectural practices, 6a Architects and Sanchez Benton Architects, has achieved planning permission for a home approaching 3,100 sq ft, arranged along one side of a dramatic quadruple height space in a series of refined steel and glass-framed galleries.  The Building  Cromwell is one of three towers within the Barbican estate, along with Shakespeare and Lauderdale. Built in 1973 as part of Phase III of the City’s bold and ambitious building programme for the site, it is the eastern-most of the original towers, resting at the junction of Beech Street and Silk Street, near the Arts Centre, the Conservatory (at Podium level) and is the closest of the three to Moorgate.  The site itself occupies four levels at the base of Cromwell Tower, bounded to the south by Silk Street and, to the west, by the Barbican Upper Podium level, with a four-storey frontage to the south and two-storey frontage to the west. The latter façade, looking out onto the Podium at the upper level, is fully glazed and enjoys views over Nigel Dunnett’s award-winning planting scheme for the Barbican High Walk.  The Architects  In 1951 the City of London ran a competition for architects to submit plans for a scheme to replace buildings destroyed by a night of bombing in December 1940. The proposal was to be called the Golden Lane Estate. Peter Chamberlin, Geoffrey Powell and Christoph Bon all submitted plans and agreed that if one of their practices won, they would form a partnership and work together on the project. Powell won the competition, and thus Chamberlin, Powell & Bon was formed in 1952. After their success with the Golden Lane Estate, the firm was asked to design the Barbican Estate, now arguably London’s most iconic brutalist complex. For more information about The Barbican, please see the History section.  The design for The Void Space at Cromwell Tower has been developed by 6a architects who have a deserved reputation for creating award-winning architecture within existing buildings of significant heritage value and for running what has become an increasingly international practice. Architects Carlos Sanchez and Tom Benton met while working at 6a architects from 2010 to 2017 and established Sanchez Benton Architects in 2017. Sanchez And Benton continue to have a close working relationship with 6a Architects and were selected by their client to act as collaborators on envisioning occupation of The Void Space design as presented in the renders appearing here.  The Tour  Currently, access to the site is via the Silk Street frontage, a few steps above the surrounding street level. The design proposes to reimagine the Silk Street entrance through the introduction of an elegantly planted entry platform. Additionally, the design accommodates the opportunity to create access via the main foyer entrance of Cromwell Tower, which provides the amenity of 24-hour porterage.  The primary structural and material expression of The Void Space is exposed concrete, punctuated by expansive areas of robustly detailed steel-framed glazing. On the longer, lower levels, the concrete has a moderately fair-faced finish; on the Podium level and above, the concrete has a finely honed bush-hammered surface. The rich texture of the concrete and rhythmic sequence of the glazing set a dramatic and monumental backdrop against which the refined and elegant delicacy of the residential occupation will play out.  The proposed design takes the form of three ‘shelves’ stacked vertically along the length of the void to create long, elegant living spaces. Rising in the void, these spaces are connected by a steel stair, simple in concept and form but spanning an extraordinary distance and scale, rare for a residential setting. Correspondingly, the design embodies a vertical hierarchy strongly akin to the formal arrangement of a London townhouse; the more public spaces of the home will be arranged on the lower levels, and the more intimate spaces will be set out across the upper floors.  The kitchen will be placed at ground level, where cooking, pantry and utility areas are to be set beneath the first-floor level, with dining and socialising spilling out into the volume of the void. A living room, library and guest WC will span the first-floor level, and this floor will provide the opportunity for access to the mezzanine lobby of Cromwell Tower.  Two rooms will occupy the second floor. These could be arranged as two bedrooms or as a bedroom and study, depending on needs. A bathroom will be positioned between them. The main bedroom suite is proposed for the third floor, spanning the entire length of the shell, allowing for an elegant sequence of reposing, sleeping, dressing and bathing spaces.  Outdoor Space  As the Barbican’s name indicates, one of the principal intents of the original master plan was to provide an enclosed sanctuary for the Estate’s residents. Within the Barbican, both public and private outdoor spaces are concentrated centrally, and residents have access to a number of both private and public gardens within the enclosure of The Estate.  The principal private gardens extend to approximately two and a half acres and are sited at the Eastern and Western ends of the Barbican lake, which itself extends to over one and a half acres. These gardens are laid out in a naturalistic manner with expansive lawns, punctuated by the cover of foliage from various species of mature trees and surrounded by rich and textural borders planted with both native and exotic species. This whole ensemble makes for a tranquil and secluded retreat within the heart of the city, and this resource is often seen as one of the most unexpected but cherished aspects of life in the Barbican.  There are dedicated areas for children’s play along with a variety of architectural follies, including a brutalist waterfall and a sunken garden and seating area, which is set within the lake.  The Area  The Barbican has a wealth of public facilities available to residents within the Arts Centre, with its theatre, art gallery,  concert venue, cinemas, and several bars and cafes. The City of London has recently appointed Allies and Morrison. Architects and Asif Khan Studio to deliver a multi-million-pound renewal of the Barbican Centre. The Centre forms is a key part of ‘Culture Mile’, the City of London’s cultural district, which stretches from Farringdon to Moorgate. The ‘Cultural Mile’ includes the Guildhall School of Music & Drama, the London Symphony Orchestra and the Museum of London. It provides a vibrant and creative area with a diverse and international cultural program of concerts, events, and performances.  The apartment is near an excellent selection of pubs and restaurants, including the nearby Smithfield Market, St. John, Luca, The Quality Chop House, and the Exmouth Market. Whitecross Street also has a food market every weekday. St Paul’s, the River Thames, the South Bank and Tate Modern are all close by.  Transport links are excellent, with Underground stations at nearby Barbican (Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan Lines), Old Street (Northern Line), Farringdon (Circle, Hammersmith & City, and Metropolitan Lines, plus Thameslink services to Gatwick Airport, Brighton and Bedford) and Moorgate (Northern, Hammersmith & City, Circle and Metropolitan Lines). The Elizabeth Line has recently commenced service from Farringdon. This station now offers high-speed transit across the East-West axis of London, extending out to Heathrow (with a direct service from Farringdon to Heathrow scheduled to start in Spring 2023).  Tenure: Leasehold Lease Length: approx. 85 years remaining Ground Rent: approx. £10 per annum Service Charge: approx. £10,000 per annum Council Tax Band: G

long_description: Cromwells are pleased to offer to the market this three bedroom semi detached family home with garage, ideally located within easy reach of all the amenities of Cheam Village and Sutton Town Centre, including a variety of shops, restaurants, gyms and open spaces. Sutton, West Sutton and Cheam mainline railway stations are all within walking distance, offering direct links into Central London. There are also several well regarded schools nearby. Accommodation On the ground floor there is an open plan lounge/diner with access to a fitted kitchen. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom. Outside There is a driveway to the front of the property for off road parking, for two cars as well as a garage with additional parking The rear garden is easily manageable. Open Day Sat 25th June This well presented four bedroom semi-detached family home situated along a highly sought after road is being offered with No Onward Chain.  Comprises: Hallway | good size front reception room | extended dining room opening into a lovely lounge overlooking the rear | kitchen/breakfast room | conservatory | downstairs cloakroom | four bedrooms | family bathroom | separate shower room | loft room | garage with off road parking | 90ft West facing rear garden. This well presented, four bedroom semi-detached family home, situated along a highly sought after road is being offered for sale with No Onward Chain.  The property offers spacious and versatile accommodation as well as having plenty of potential to extend further if needed.  The property briefly comprises an impressive hallway, large front reception room, an extended dining room that opens into aa lovely bright and airy lounge that overlooks and opens onto the rear garden.  The kitchen offers a range of modern cupboards, drawers and worktop surfaces along with space for all the usual appliances and somewhere to sit down for breakfast. There's a large conservatory to the side of the house that opens into the garage as well as doors leading out to the garden.  On the first floor you'll find four good size bedrooms, a modern bathroom that could be used as an en-suite for the master bedroom and a separate walk in shower room. Stairs lead up to a very useful loft room offering plenty of storage space.  Outside, there’s a garage to the side with off street parking for several cars and a 90ft x 36ft west facing rear garden.

Lease remaining - 95 years Lease term - 125yrs from 25th December 1991 Accommodation  - Door into communal hall, stairs to first floor. Front door into Entrance Hall Security phone entry system, coved ceiling, dado rail, panelled radiator, fitted carpet. bullet_points: Two Bedroom;Third Floor Flat;Open Plan Living Space;Modern Kitchen & Bathroom;Secure Gated Parking;Lift Service;Walking Distance To Sutton Mainline Station & Various Transport Links
long_description: SUMMARY A highly desirable two bedroom third floor flat situated in a sought after development and convenient location within easy reach of local amenities and transport links. DESCRIPTION A highly desirable two bedroom third floor flat situated in a sought after and convenient location within easy reach of local amenities and transport links. This impressive development has so much to offer with lift service and secure underground gated parking. This flat is stunning throughout and comprises of an open plan reception room offering a spacious & airy feel. The modern kitchen is beautifully fitted and offers plenty of storage cupboards and work top space. There are two bedrooms both substantial in size and a fantastic three piece bathroom suite. There are a number of large windows throughout the property which allows a great amount of natural light to flood through creating a relaxing atmosphere. Furthermore, Sutton Mainline Station is within walking distance which has easy links to London Victoria with the fastest train being approximately 27 minutes. Sutton Town Centre has plenty to offer with a number of shops, restaurants, cafes and a variety of bus routes to Morden, Wallington, Wimbledon & Tooting. bullet_points: Six Bedroom Extended Semi Detached House;0.6 Miles To Carshalton Train Station;Kitchen-Dining Room;Potential To Extend To Rear & Loft (STPP);Large Rear Garden With Outbuilding/Home Office;Driveway For Multiple Cars;Close To Great Primary & Secondary Schools;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: The Property Six bedroom extended family house with extended kitchen-dining room, spacious reception room, scope to extend to the rear & loft space, driveway, private rear garden and within 0.6 miles of Carshalton train station making this a great family home. The property has a spacious kitchen-diner to the rear of the house with cupboard space to three sides, space for a table & chairs and door leading out to the rear garden. There is a large lounge and another reception room/bedroom to the front of the property. To the first floor, there are four double bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side. There is a slightly smaller bedroom ideally used as a child's room or study/office space. The family bathroom has a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin and towel rail. Outside - To the front there is a block paved driveway with space for multiple vehicles. The private rear garden is a great space with a patio area leading onto the lawn. There is a large garden shed and log cabin to the far end of the garden with power & lighting which could be used as a office space/playroom/home gym. Location The property is located 0.6 miles from Carshalton train station which has links into London Victoria, London Blackfriars & Sutton. For primary schools, both Harris Junior Academy Carshalton & Muschamp Primary School are 0.5 miles away and both Victor Seymour Infants' School & Manor Park Primary Academy are within 0.6 miles. For secondary schools, both Greenshaw High School & Carshalton High School for Girls are 0.4 miles away and both St Philomena's Catholic High School for Girls & Sutton Grammar School are 0.6 miles away. Both Sutton & Carshalton Village are within walking distance and there are nearby regular bus links to Morden for access to the tube (Northern Line). Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

bullet_points: 4 Bedroom family home;close to amenities;Garden office/studio;Council Tax Band  F;EPC Rating C;Freehold
long_description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire this beautiful 4 bedroom family home located just minutes from Carshalton Beeches station and surrounded by local amenities including outstanding schools, shops, restaurants, transport & leisure facilities. The property is presented in exquisite condition and benefits from a spacious front lounge with large bay window, fireplace and beautifully kept parquet flooring which can be found throughout the majority of the ground floor. The open plan kitchen/reception area is simply to die for.  Offering plenty of space for large family gatherings, with its attractive lounge/dining area offering views out to the rear garden as well as modern kitchen design with access to a separate utility room. The garden is tranquil with just the sounds of birds and Carshalton tennis club to listen to whilst laying back in a sun lounge sipping on your favourite beverage.  With working from home a popular option for many the garden offers a office/studio as well as a lawn area for the kids to have a kick about. Back inside the property you will find four bedrooms two with en-suite as well as a luxury family bathroom.  There is also a pull down loft ladder leading to fantastic loft area with velux window. For more information and to arrange a viewing call Christies today on   Brochures Crichton Road, Carshalton

A beautifully presented four bedroom chalet bungalow located within the highly desirable South Cheam area conveniently positioned on a quiet horse shoe road. The property and its location really does provide a perfect balance of size, versatility and convenience.  Cheam Village is less than a 1/4 mile from this family home offering many shops, amenities, cafes and restaurants and not forgetting the excellent and frequent transport facilities and highly regarded schools. The property boasts over 2000 sq. ft of accommodation comprising two living rooms, dining room, kitchen/breakfast room, four double bedrooms with family bathroom and two shower rooms. The current owner previously utilised the side aspect as a self contained annex and is equipped for this along with having easy disabled access as well.  Additional features complimenting this home include private off street parking, internal garage, landscaped rear garden and potential to further extend (stpp). Watch the walk-through Video Tour.  A rare opportunity to live in a much sought after secluded development in South Wallington. Situated at the end of a picturesque cul-de-sac within close proximity to excellent local schools including Wallington County Grammar School for Girls, Wallington County Grammar School for Boys, Wilson’s School and The John Fisher School, is this modern three (Formerly four) bedroom, two bathroom, detached house with a modern, yet homely feel. This uniquely stylish home offering open plan living, has been extended to the rear  by the present owners to incorporate a wall of frameless glass curtain doors making the living area feel part of the professionally landscaped garden. The ground floor also benefits from a luxury shower room with wet-room style shower and a separate outside large walk-in storage room housing the utility meters and with ample room for storage and coats. A double length garage provides parking and further generous storage. Upstairs, the formerly four-bedroom, house has had a stud wall removed to create a large master and guest bedroom, but would easily convert back if so desired. *NO ONWARD CHAIN* Accommodation  - Bespoke front door with Banham security locks leading to... Modern Open Plan Living Area Large triple aspect room with double glazed windows to front and sides and an entire wall of frameless glass curtain doors to rear. Areas have been zoned and separated by clever use of shelving style wall dividers and furniture, creating a spacious, modern, yet homely feel. Underfloor heating to all of ground floor, three ceiling skylights, zoned ceiling downlights throughout and a large under-stair storage cupboard. There is also a  wall mounted, fob activated touch-pad for the monitored alarm system complete with motion detectors. Kitchen area Corian work surfaces with modern high gloss doors and cupboards below, matching wall units with under lighting, matching centre island with inset Bosch five ring gas hob and ceiling mounted stainless steel tubular extractor/cooker hood above, built-in Bosch eye-level double-oven, space for a slimline dishwasher and American style fridge freezer, integrated washing machine, built-in shelving to island, mosaic tiled splashback. Downstairs Shower room Large walk in tiled wet room, shower area with feature mosaic tiled walls, tiled floor and chrome shower fittings, chrome wall mounted radiator/towel rail, wash hand basin with modern chrome mixer tap and illuminated mirror above, low-level WC with concealed cistern and push-button flush, tiled walls and flooring, two UPVC double glazed windows to side and front, ceiling downlights, extractor fan. Stairs to 1st floor landing Large UPVC double glazed window to front aspect with commanding view. Bedroom 1 Formally two bedrooms converted into one (stud wall removed), so easily converted back to a four bedroom house if desired. Wall of modern fitted wardrobes with double hanging in most cupboards, two UPVC double glazed windows to rear aspect, modern style radiator. Bedroom 2 UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, wall of built-in double wardrobes, modern style radiator. Bedroom 3 UPVC double glazed window to front aspect, built-in wardrobe/cupboard, modern style radiator. Bathroom Luxury style bathroom comprising mosaic tile enclosed inset steel bath with mosaic surround/vanity area and modern chrome mixer tap, large shower enclosure with mosaic tiled walls and chrome shower fittings, wash hand basin with modern chrome mixer tap, low-level WC with concealed cistern and push-button flush, built-in vanity area, tiled walls with large inset mirror, chrome radiator/towel rail, tiled flooring with underfloor heating, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect, ceiling downlights. Garden Landscaped garden set on a hill with beautifully maintained well stocked mature shrub planting in a Japanese style, artificial lawn area to the front, patio area to left of artificial lawn area, steps up to rear of garden and further patio area, outside tap and light, side access, fully enclosed fencing . bullet_points: Ready made property investment opportunity;Superb 5% yield;Second (top) floor apartment;Purpose-built residential development;One spacious double bedroom;Modern fully-fitted kitchen with appliances;Intercom access;Well-maintained communal gardens;Allocated parking space;Close to local amenities and transport links
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with yieldit yieldit are pleased to present this excellent tenanted investment opportunity! This wonderful apartment is located on the top (second) floor in a purpose-built residential block. The accommodation has an abundance of natural light ensuring a light and airy feel throughout and compromises of; an entrance hall; spacious double bedroom; a modern fully-fitted kitchen complete with appliances; a family bathroom with white three-piece suite; a good-sized, carpeted living room and a large loft ideal for storage. Residents of the development have the benefit of intercom access, wall mounted electric heaters, double glazing, well-maintained communal gardens and allocated parking.  Ross Road is conveniently situated to easily access Wallington High Street which provides local amenities and a great selection of shops and restaurants. The town centre also has a gym, library, healthcare centre and parks such as Beddington Park and Mellows Park. Wallington offers brilliant public transport links via road and rail, with Wallington station providing regular services to central London making it perfect for commuters. Now is a brilliant time to invest in property in the London Borough of Sutton, the Council have committed to a period of significant regeneration for it’s town centre to transform it into a vibrant and bustling destination with a strong economy. £26million was recently invested in St Nicholas shopping centre and there are further plans to create music venues, a rooftop garden and street food stalls. Enquire today to discuss this exciting property investment opportunity. long_description: Nestled in one of Morden/Sutton's most convenient residential roads, this wonderful home has so much to offer, both inside and out. Firstly, we have to talk location. Have you ever dreamed of living on the doorstep of fabulous amenities, open spaces, schools and transport links?  Halesowen Road will surpass your expectations, as it's just a short distance to either Morden and Sutton, with you having Outstanding schooling close by. St Hellier, Sutton Common and Morden Tube stations provide quick links into the City - you'll be from your sofa to London in just under an hour, amazing!  Despite all of this, sitting in your stunning landscaped garden, you'd be forgiven for thinking you were in the middle of nowhere - a tranquil space for you to enjoy a good book, catch some rays or even have a few friends over.  Inside your home, you can't fail to be amazed by the amount of work that has been done on the house, as it has been totally refurbished from top to bottom, meaning you can move in and enjoy immediately! Work from home? We have great news for you! Upstairs, there is a fantastic master bedroom with en-suite and a further 2 great sized bedrooms, so it will be a tough choice about which one to work or kids to sleep in!  On the ground floor there is a huge amount of versatility, so be prepared to be impressed. A fabulous lounge is great for cozy nights in - with space for a dining area, a perfect room for everyone to come together.  When this happens, the outstanding, modern kitchen is also a great space to cook, being a truly well thought out and designed place for you to enhance your culinary skills. A further bathroom is also located on the ground floor for maximum convenience.  Outside is where you will really be able to spread you wings, with a a delightful garden that is a perfect size with large decked area, along with the front of the property basting a driveway that offers ample off street parking. Ground Floor  -  Hallway  -  Porch  -  Living/Dining Room  - 4.04m x 3.58m (13'3 x 11'9) -  Kitchen  - 3.56m x 1.91m (11'8 x 6'3) -  Bathroom  - 1.78m x 1.70m (5'10 x 5'7) -  First Floor  -  Landing  -  Bedroom 1  - 3.53m x 2.79m (11'7 x 9'2) -  En-Suite  - 1.80m x 1.75m (5'11 x 5'9) -  Bedroom 2  - 3.25m x 2.79m (10'8 x 9'2) -  Bedroom 3  - 2.57m x 2.26m (8'5 x 7'5) -  Outside  -  Driveway  -  Rear Garden  -  Brochures Halesowen Road, Morden Brochure

long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 161 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain. One double bedroom flat with spacious lounge-dining room, modern kitchen & bathroom, 160 year lease, garage, off street parking, communal gardens and within 0.3 miles of Sutton train station making this ideal for 1st time buyers & professionals. There is a secure communal entrance with stairs leading up to the first floor. The flat has an entrance hallway storage space to one side, there is a spacious lounge-dining room with window to the front of the property. There is a separate kitchen with cupboard space to three sides, integrated electric hob, fan oven, washing machine and space for a fridge-freezer. There is a good sized double bedroom with space for wardrobes & chest of drawers, the modern bathroom is tiled throughout with a shower over the bath, w/c, hand basin with storage below and towel rail. Outside - The is garage with up & over door, off street parking and well maintained communal gardens for residents use only. Lease - 160 years remaining. Location The property is located 0.3 miles from Sutton train station which has links into London Victoria, London Bridge, West Croydon & Epsom. Sutton town centre is within a few minutes walk and offers a great range of restaurants, shops and local amenities for all ages. long_description: A GOOD SIZE TWO BEDROOM GROUND FLOOR PURPOSE BUILT FLAT. Kenyons are pleased to offer this well presented ground floor flat which forms part of a popular development within walking distance of Wallington town centre and train station. The property offers spacious rooms and benefits from double glazed windows and a garage. The flat is conveniently located within ¼ of a mile from Wallington town centre which offers a wide range of shopping, leisure and transport facilities including several bus services and a mainline train station giving access to central London and the surrounding areas. Viewing strongly recommended.  * COMMUNAL ENTRANCE HALL *  RECEPTION HALL * * DOUBLE ASPECT LIVING ROOM * KITCHEN * TWO BEDROOMS * * BATHROOM * DOUBLE GLAZING * COMMUMAL GARDENS * * GARAGE IN BLOCK * CONVIENIENT LOCATION * * LONG LEASE PLUS SHARE OF FREEHOLD * * NO CHAIN *  ACCOMMODATION:   COMMUNAL ENTRANCE HALL: Entry phone system.  RECEPTION HALL: Storage cupboard, night storage heater, further cupboard housing water tanks, wood block flooring.  LIVING ROOM: 14'10 x 14'1. Being double aspect via double glazed windows, night storage heater, wood block flooring.  KITCHEN: 8'1 x 7'7. Range of base and eye level units, work-surfaces, sink unit, appliance space, hatch to living room, double glazed window.    BEDROOM ONE: 13'11 x 9'2. Double glazed window, wall mounted electric heater, built-in storage cupboard.  BEDROOM TWO: 12'10 x 9'0 - Narrowing to 7'3. Double glazed window, wall mounted electric heater.  BATHROOM: 8'11 x 5'3. With a white suite comprising of panel enclosed bath with electric shower over, pedestal wash hand basin, low flush W.C., part tiled walls, obscure double glazed window.  OUTSIDE:  COMMUNAL GARDENS: Well maintained communal gardens surround the block being mainly laid to lawn with various shrubs and plants..  SINGLE GARAGE IN BLOCK:  TENURE: SHARE of FREEHOLD.- Although the property is being sold with a share of the freehold we have been informed by the vendor that there is also a long lease on the property 999 years from 1993, therefore there is approximately 971 years remaining. Currently there is a service charge of £547.50 per ½ year and a ground rent charge of £6 per ½ year. The vendor would also like to point out that the service charge also include window cleaning, garden maintenance and cleaning of the communal areas - However prospective purchasers are advised to check these details with their solicitors.    NOTICE TO PURCHASERS:  Kenyons Estate Agents and their staff have not carried out any tests to any items mentioned within these details, which include services such as heating, electrical system, appliance or any fixture and fittings. long_description: This three bedroom family home sits on the borders of both Sutton and Carshalton and is presented in good decorative order. This bright and airy home features many attributes of its 1930s vintage, including bay fronted windows to both the ground floor sitting room and the first floor master bedroom.  Further two bedrooms and a family bathroom complete the first floor accommodation.  The garden boasts a patio and a further raised deck area to the rear where a brick out-building is also situated.  Separate ground floor reception rooms provide options and buyers will have their own thoughts on how to configure to suit them best.  Off street parking is provided at the front of the property with space for two cars. bullet_points: Detached;;Seven Bedrooms;;Six Bathrooms;;Immaculate / Luxury Décor;;Stunning Kitchen Family Room;;Ability to create two houses or one;;Prime South Cheam Location
long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Fine & Country Having been crafted with meticulous attention to detail, the property offers a flexible accommodation to suit most families in any guise.   Meadowside Road is a prime, tree-lined South Cheam Road. Private tennis club to one end and a looping exit the other. Beyond its calm, settled aura the walking distance back to the village centre and Cheam station are certainly highlights.   Nestled into the elbow of the road, this large, detached house fills the corner. The driveway immediately offers multiple off-street parking spaces, and the road has additional parking opportunities.    A exceptionally large house offering seven bedrooms, three reception rooms, six bathrooms. All in immaculate condition.    Externally, the south facing rear garden offers a sunny aspect, sun patio off the house. The garden measures 19 x 27m (max).   To experience the best of South Cheam, simply take a walk around the area on a sunny evening. It’s the sort of place you will want to spend time and grow as a family. Mixing the best of Greater London and Surrey, the area offers excellent schooling, family amenities and transport to central London and the south coast. Golf Clubs, tennis clubs, fitness centres and a village centre with shops, bars and restaurants are all within a short walk. Cheam Village train station links Victoria and London Bridge in less than 40 mins and the A3, A217 and M25 provide road networks to the whole country.   In summary, this is an exceptional house!  This house is different from most other types of property you have seen. The ability to have such a spacious interior with either division or inclusion, depending on needs, is the main draw. Supporting the layout, the high-quality décor and fixtures ensure an easy life and the chance to impress all who visit. The mix of location, condition, layout, and size must tick all boxes. The property is offered without an onward chain, and we highly recommend your interest.
