bullet_points: Three Bedroom End Of Terrace House;0.2 Miles To Sutton Common Train Station;Potential To Extend To Rear & Loft (STPP);Private Rear Garden;Driveway For Multiple Cars;Close To Great Primary & Secondary Schools;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: The Property Three bedroom end of terrace family house with open plan lounge-dining room, scope to extend to the rear & loft space (STPP), driveway, private rear garden and 0.2 miles of Sutton Common train station making this an ideal family home. Entering the property, the hallway has storage space below the stairs and leads through to the spacious lounge-dining room. The lounge area is to the front of the property with feature fireplace to one side. The dining room is to the rear and also has a fireplace to one side and patio doors leading out to the rear garden. The separate kitchen has cupboard space to two sides, integrated gas hob, fan oven, space and plumbing for fridge-freezer & washing machine, there is also door leading out to the rear garden. To the first floor, there are two double bedrooms with built in wardrobes to one side. There is a smaller third bedroom ideally used as a child's room or study/office space. The family bathroom has a separate shower cubicle, bath, w/c and hand basin. Outside - To the front there is a paved driveway for multiple cars and shared access to the side of the property. The private rear garden has an artificial lawn area leading up to the raised patio with space for a table & chairs. Location The property is located 0.2 miles from Sutton Common train station which has links into London Blackfriars and Sutton. Sutton train station is 0.9 miles away and has links into London Victoria, London Bridge, Clapham Junction & Epsom. There are bus routes in close proximity with links to Morden tube station (Northern Line). For primary schools, All Saints Benhilton CofE Primary School is 0.2 miles away, Westbourne Primary School is 0.4 miles away and Robin Hood Junior School is within 0.5 miles. For secondary schools, Sutton Grammar School is 0.5 miles away, Greenshaw High School is 0.6 miles away and Glenthorne High School is within 0.7 miles. Sutton town centre is a short walk away and offers a great range of shops, restaurants and local amenities for all ages. bullet_points: Three Bedroom Semi Detached Family House;0.6 Miles To Sutton Common Train Station;Extended Open Plan Kitchen-Dining Room;Potential To Extend To The Loft (STPP);Modern Bathroom & Downstairs W/C;Private Rear Garden;Driveway For Multiple Cars;Close To Good Primary, Secondary & Grammar Schools;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: The Property Three bedroom extended semi detached house with large open plan kitchen-dining room, separate lounge, modern family bathroom, downstairs w/c, private rear garden, close to good primary, secondary & Grammar schools and within 0.6 miles of Sutton Common train station making this a great family home. The property has an entrance hallway leading to the lounge at the front of the property with feature fireplace to one side. The rear of the property has been extended to create a stunning open plan kitchen-dining room with bi-folding doors across the rear leading out to the garden. The kitchen has cupboard space to two sides and island unit with integrated electric hob, fan oven, fridge-freezer, dishwasher and washing machine. There is space for a dining table and chairs to one side. The property also benefits from a downstairs w/c off the hallway. To the first floor, there are three bedrooms with the front & rear master bedroom benefiting from built in wardrobes to one side. There is a slightly smaller third bedroom ideally used as a child's room or study/office space. The modern family bathroom has a separate shower cubicle, bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. Outside - To the front there is a driveway with space for multiple vehicles and a secure side gate leading to the rear garden. The private rear garden has a patio area with space for seating leading onto the lawn. At the far end of the garden there is a garage/outbuilding for additional storage space and has power and lighting. Location The property is located 0.6 miles of Sutton Common train station which has links to London Blackfriars, London Bridge, Sutton & Wimbledon. Carshalton train station is 0.8 miles away and has links to London Victoria and Clapham Junction. For primary schools, All Saints Benhilton CofE Primary School is 0.4 miles away, Manor Park Primary Academy & Victor Seymour Infants' School are within 0.8 miles. For secondary schools, Greenshaw High School is 0.2 miles away, Carshalton Boys Sports College is 0.5 miles away and Sutton Grammar School is within 0.6 miles. Carshalton Village and Sutton town center are close-by with a great array of restaurants, shops and local amenities making it a great family area. long_description: Black + Blanc Land & New Homes are delighted to launch this wonderful one-bedroom ground floor apartment located on the popular Manor Road, Wallington. The property offers an impressive internal gross area of 447sq. ft. which is rare to find in new build properties in the local area, especially being a stone throw away from the Wallington Station.The property consists of one double bedroom, a spacious living/dining area and a modern three piece suite bathroom.  The property is being offered with a brand new 125-year lease, as per the developer’s information and both service charge/ground rent are reasonable. The apartment has been finished to an exceptional standard from herringbone flooring through to contemporary décor with a tasteful palette, the bathrooms have been installed with Porcel Nosa tiling and Porcel Nosa bathroom fixtures.  Lincoln House is perfectly located in the heart of Wallington; Manor Road is a high street location and is within 0.1 miles approximately of Wallington train station (a stone throws away). This is a perfect property for commuters working in the city and you can be in London Bridge within 26 minutes. Brochures Full Details

long_description: Looking for space? Then look no further. This larger than average extended four-bedroom family home is not to be missed. bullet_points: No Onward Chain;Two Double Bedrooms;First Floor Flat;Lease - 960 Years Remaining;Lounge-Dining Room;Separate Shower & Bath;Communal Gardens;Ideal For First Time Buyers & Young Families;Allocated Parking Space;Double Glazed & Central Heating
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 960 years remaining The Property No Onward Chain - Two double bedroom first floor flat beautifully presented throughout with open plan lounge-dining room, 950 year lease, allocated parking space and within 1 mile to West Sutton & Stoneleigh train stations. The property has a communal entrance with stairs leading up to the property. The flat has an open plan lounge-dining room area with parquet flooring, bay window area overlooking the communal gardens and plenty of room for a sofa and dining table & chairs. The separate kitchen has cupboard space to both sides and an integrated gas hob, electric fan oven, dishwasher, space and plumbing for a fridge-freezer and washing machine. The master bedroom has a built in wardrobe to one side, bay window area and parquet flooring. The second bedroom also benefits from parquet flooring and has space for a wardrobe & chest of drawers. The family bathroom has a separate shower cubicle, bath, w/c, hand basin and heated towel rail. Outside - The property has an allocated parking space for 1 car and there are well maintained communal gardens surrounding the development. Lease - 960 years remaining. Service Charge & Ground Rent - £164 pcm. Location The property is located 1 mile from Stoneleigh and West Sutton train station which have links into London Victoria, London Bridge and London Waterloo. For primary schools, Meadow Primary School is within 0.4 miles and both Nonsuch Primary School & Cheam Fields Primary Academy are within 0.5 miles. For secondary schools, Cheam High School is 0.5 miles away, Nonsuch High School for Girls is 1 mile away and Glenthorne High School is within 1.4 miles. The property is within walking distance of local shops, restaurants and local amenities in the North Cheam area and both Cheam Village and Worcester Park are a few minutes away. DESCRIPTION A beautifully presented extended three bedroom semi-detached family home situated in a really popular location. This super house enjoys generous living space which opens on to a lovely big rear garden, there is a garage and a generous driveway, the property is located 3/4 mile of Worcester Park's mainline station and town centre. There is plenty of space to work from home. Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to Waterloo in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both of London's Airports. Bus services run to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. The attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Nandos, Costa, Caffe Nero, Starbucks Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug as well as an array of independents.There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to the area's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks. 1. bullet_points: Three bedroom detached family home;Garage;Driveway ;Lovely Garden ;Potential to extend;Separate Kitchen;Large lounge area
long_description: SUMMARY A three bedroom detached family home situated in a favourable road, close to Wallington's Grammar schools. DESCRIPTION This handsome house is ideally located and has lots of potential for a new family to put their stamp on. Guests and occupiers are well catered for with on road parking available to the front, as well as a garage and drive. On the ground floor the property benefits from a bright entrance hall, good-size kitchen, WC, and a reception room with doors leading to a rear level garden that offers a patio area. The first floor comprises of three bedrooms and a family bathroom. The family bathroom has a bath and shower. On the landing there is access to the loft, which offers further scope to extend. Overall, the house feels spacious and very functional, the windows give a light and airy feeling to the property, with the possibility that any new owner would be able to extend the rear of the home and into the loft (STPP). Externally the garden is a good size and easily maintained. The large patio leads off from the house and onto the lawn. The large level garden provides ample space to enjoy and for any family to grow. Bute Road is favourable road, popular with families seeking the excellent nearby schooling. In the heart of Wallington town centre and Purley Way, the convenient location offers the modern family a host of shopping options. Wallington has quite a comprehensive high street with banking, restaurants, supermarkets and independent retailers to choose. Local schools include Bandon Hill, St Elphege's, Wilson's and Wallington High School for Boys Agents Note This property has an offer accepted subject to contract but is still currently available to view. 1. bullet_points: DETACHED FAMILY HOME;OFF STREET PARKING;FOUR BEDROOMS;EPC RATING D;Council Tax Band G;Freehold
long_description: A fantastic opportunity to acquire this lovingly maintained four bedroom detached family home which benefits from a variety of local transport links. The property benefits from two beautiful reception rooms both of which have large bay windows. The ground floor is finished off with a wonderfully finished kitchen/breakfast room and separate cloakroom. Upstairs you are presented with three generous double bedrooms, additional single room, three piece bathroom and separate WC. Additional advantages for this home include a garage, stunning rear garden and off street parking for multiple cars. The property is well located for public transport with Cheam Rail Station located near by. Local schools in the area consist of but are not limited to Avenue Primary School and The Harris Academy. To arrange your viewing call our sales team on  . Brochures Beresford Road, Cheam

The property requires modernisation throughout however it offers a wealth of scope to extend and improve STPP.  Ideally positioned for access to North Cheam, Stonecot Hill and Worcester Park amenities including several bus routes, shops and Worcester Park mainline station.  The property benefits from off street parking, 2 double bedrooms and private rear garden.  Internal viewing is highly recommended. long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Andrews Estate Agents VIEWINGS BY APPOINTMENT ON SATURDAY JUNE 18TH.  This three bedroom house, in need of refurbishment, is located in an area known for it's schools and transport links. Featuring a garden and off street parking. VIEWINGS BY APPOINTMENT ON SATURDAY JUNE 18TH.  From the entrance hall you turn left into the front reception room featuring a front aspect bay window. The next turning on the left is the rear reception room which has sliding patio doors leading onto the garden.    The kitchen has laminate work tops, ground and wall mounted storage units, plumbed for washing machine and dishwasher, boiler cupboard, insert sink, space for electric cooker and hob.  On the 1st floor are 3 bedrooms, 2 of which are doubles and both feature storage cupboards. The third bedroom has a front aspect window.  There is a family bathroom has a rear aspect obscured double glazed window, panel bath, low level WC, heated towel rail and hand basin unit.   The garden measures 61’ x 17’7 and features a lawn and patio area, fencing on all sides and a storage shed.  There is also off street parking at the front. If you’re looking to renovate a property to your own specifications then this is very much worth a viewing.  LOCATION    This property is located off Sutton Common Road which is a sought after area due to its excellent local schools which the London Borough of Sutton is well known for, with main school being Glenthorne Secondary  Local bus routes will take you to Stonecot Hill where there are local shops and from here you can jump on the 93 bus which will take you to Morden Underground station which is on the Northern Line. Sutton Common Railway Station is Thames link and Southern Trains with services to Wimbledon, Sutton and Mitcham Junction.   DISCLAIMER   Andrews Estate Agents are unable to confirm whether statutory consents have been obtained for the extension(s)/conversion/alterations. It is the responsibility of all prospective purchasers to ensure that they and their legal representatives make all necessary enquiries with regard to these alterations as part of any conveyancing.

Wallington station is a short walk which has direct access into both London Bridge and London Victoria. All local amenities are at your doorstep putting this property in an ideal location. (Please note: this apartment has been virtually staged and the furniture is not in the property) Viewings of this property is highly advised. | Leasehold Information | Council tax band: NotSet

station_info: [(0.6, 'Waddon Station', 'svg-nationalrail'), (0.9, 'Waddon Marsh Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink'), (0.9, 'Wandle Park Tram Stop', 'svg-tramlink')]
long_description: Rare opportunity to purchase this lovely freehold building in the heart of Beddington, near Croydon. This mixed use building is perfect for landlords, business owners or developers with various permutations possible. It comprises of a well sized ground floor commercial unit measuring approx. 700 sqft and a 3 bedroom or 2 x 2 bedroom flat (can be configured either way) above it which is approx 960 sqft .  The vendor is willing to take on a FRI lease on the ground floor commercial unit for £18,000 per annum for 15 years, with 4 yearly rent reviews and no breaks.  The upper flat/flats will be sold with vacant possession and gives numerous possibilities, one of them being to rent as an HMO (House of Multiple Occupancy). The upper floors can be renovated to get an uplift in the market rent or lived in as they are. Great opportunity to buy in a popular area walking distance to Waddon train station and close to many of the conveniences Beddington, Wallington and Croydon offer. There are sought after schools nearby and any landlord can be confident that it will attract excellent calibre tenants. | Council tax band: NotSet

long_description: James Bailey is proud to present this fantastic one bedroom period conversion apartment. Offered in excellent condition throughout the property has a large master bedroom, an open plan reception, a fitted kitchen and modern bathroom. The property has a 125 year lease and comes with No Chain. Egmont Road is located just 0.6 miles from Sutton train station providing easy access to London Victoria, London Bridge and Clapham Junction in under 25 minutes. It is also within easy reach of Sutton High Street which boasts a plethora of shops and restaurants to enjoy. Brochures Egmont Road, Sutton Brochure

The property has been tastefully modernised by the present owner and includes a stylish open plan kitchen/diner, as well as a large family bathroom. The property is ideally located close to Rosehill Park, as well as local schools, shops and transport links. Situated in a highly sought after location on the borders of Carshalton Beeches is this stunning four bedroom extended family home, close to an abundance of shops, transport links, restaurants and desirable schools. The property offers a wealth of accommodation including a spacious open plan kitchen/diner/family room, a study area, a downstairs shower room, a pretty rear garden and ample off street parking. Council Tax Band F Accommodation  - Covered entrance porch with wooden leaded light front door to… Entrance Hall Leaded light windows either side of front door, dado and picture rail, wood affect Karndean flooring, old school style radiator, large under stairs recess and further large understairs storage cupboard. Lounge UPVC double glazed bay window to front aspect, feature limestone fireplace with granite hearth and coal affect fire insert, picture rail, radiator. Study Wall mounted bookshelves, door to utility room as well as being Open Plan to kitchen/dining area/open Plan living area. Utility Room Worksurface with space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer below, UPVC double glazed door to side access, door to garage, door to… Downstairs Shower Room Large walk-in shower with Metro style tiled walls and chrome shower fittings, modern wash hand basin with chrome mixer tap and drawers below, low-level WC with push button flush, UPVC double glazed window to side aspect, ceiling downlights, chrome radiator/towel rail, extractor fan. Open Plan Living Space Kitchen area Modern two tone kitchen comprising blockwood worksurfaces with drawers and cupboards below, matching wall units, 1 1/2 bowl stainless steel sink with modern stainless steel mixer tap, built-in undercounter stainless steel Neff double oven with matching five ring gas hob and stainless steel cooker hood above, breakfast bar area, plumbing for dishwasher, space/recess for large tall fridge freezer, skylight, double glazed window to rear aspect. Dining Area Floor-to-ceiling patio doors, Wood effect Karndean flooring, ceiling downlights, open plan to… Family Room/Snug Fireplace recess with log burning stove and slate hearth, plain wall for wall mounted projector, picture rail. Stairs to 1st floor landing Access to loft, picture rail, storage cupboard with shelving. Bedroom one UPVC double glazed bay window to front aspect, range of modern built-in wardrobes to alcove, picture rail, radiator. Bedroom two UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, range of built-in wardrobes with cupboards above to alcoves and built-in shelving to chimney breast, picture rail, radiator. Bedroom three Double aspect room with UPVC double glazed windows to front and rear, picture rail, radiator. Bedroom four UPVC double glazed window to front aspect, picture rail, radiator. Bathroom Luxury bathroom with four piece suite comprising walk-in shower with chrome shower fittings, rolltop clawfoot bath with modern chrome mixer tap, large vanity sink with modern chrome mixer tap and drawers below, low-level WC with pushbutton flush, part tiled walls with Metro style tiled design and Victorian style tiled flooring, modern wall mounted radiator/towel rail,  UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, extractor fan. Garden Approximately 80ft in length mainly laid to lawn with flower and shrub borders, mature trees, good size patio area with path leading to side access, outside tap and outside lights, fencie enclosed. Front Gravel driveway allowing off street parking for several cars, brick wall enclosed. Brochures Banstead Road South, Sutton Brochure

long_description: The Property A bright and spacious two double bedroom semi detached house ideally located in this ever popular residential road just moments from Worcester Park high street with its wide range of shops and amenities, excellent bus links and mainline station with train into London Waterloo (zone 4).  Offering no onward chain, this property comprises a spacious entrance hall with under stair storage, fitted kitchen and to the rear a good sized living room with space for dining area and door to rear garden.  To the first floor there is a master bedroom with fitted storage, family bathroom and further double bedroom.  Outside this property benefits from having a private, well maintained rear garden and to the front there is off street parking.  Disclaimer for virtual viewings Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing. If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided. Brochures Brochure

Watch the walk through video tour!  An extremely well presented three bedroom semi detached house which has been renovated and extended by the present owner to include rear and side extension making a large family living area divided into zones for dining, watching TV or just chilling by the log burner.  The large modern kitchen complete with Quartz work surfaces and centre island is an ideal workspace for any cook with lovely views over the larger than average garden and there is even a spacious downstairs shower room/WC. Upstairs there are three well decorated bedrooms, two of which have modern fitted wardrobes and there is also a luxury bathroom with modern fittings including a remote controlled shower.  Most of the house has been insulated which helps with the energy bills and the loft is boarded and insulated but also has the added benefit of having had all utilities ie; hot and cold water, heating and electric connected in preparation for any loft conversion, thus avoiding much disruption to the rest of the house should this be required. The property also has an abundance of sockets and lights including wired in and remote controlled lamps in many rooms. Accommodation  - UPVC double glazed leaded light front door to… Entrance Hall Two UPVC double glazed leaded light windows either side of front door, wooden flooring, LED ceiling downlights, built-in under stairs storage housing gas and electric meters, further large built-in large cupboards for extra storage as well as extra cupboards for utility area with space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer and gas central heating boiler above, radiator. Main Open Plan Living Area Wooden flooring throughout (with the rear part of the room having underfloor heating) and LED ceiling downlights. Dining Area UPVC double glazed bay window to front aspect.  This room could be divided off from the rest of the main room to create a separate reception or bedroom.  Middle Section Snug Area Fireplace with log burning stove and granite hearth with wooden mantle above. Lounge area UPVC double glazed bifold doors to garden, wooden flooring with underfloor heating, two ceiling downlights, wall mounted TV point, two open plan style doorways to… Kitchen Quartz work surfaces with modern high gloss drawers and cupboards below as well as tall larder units, American style fridge with matching built in high gloss units around, two integrated ovens, integrated Neff electric hob with glass and stainless steel cooker hood above with quartz splashback and up stands, 1 1/2 bowl ceramic under sink with modern chrome chef style mixer tap, cupboard with space and plumbing for dishwasher behind, space for three wine cooling fridges (can be included), ceramic tiled flooring with underfloor heating, LED ceiling downlights, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect and matching door to side. Door to  Downstairs Shower Room/WC Modern white suite comprising tiled shower enclosure with chrome shower fittings, wash hand basin with modern chrome mixer tap and drawers below, illuminated heated mirror above , low-level WC with concealed cistern and pushbutton flush, chrome radiator/towel rail, part tiled walls with feature border design, LED ceiling downlights, tiled flooring with underfloor heating, extractor fan. Stairs to First Floor Landing Access to loft which is boarded and insulated.  There is also hot and cold water feeds as well as electrics and central heating pipework to the loft in preparation for a loft conversion. Ceiling downlights. Bedroom one Range of built-in modern wardrobes and bridging units with matching bedside cabinets, UPVC double glazed bay window to front, aspect, LED ceiling downlights, radiator. Bedroom two Wall of modern built-in wardrobes, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, LED ceiling downlights, radiator. Bedroom three UPVC double glazed window to front aspect, LED ceiling downlights, low cupboard housing CCTV equipment, radiator. Bathroom Luxury modern bathroom comprising tile enclosed bath with chrome shower fittings and extra remote control operation, glass shower screen, wash hand basin with modern chrome mixer tap and cupboard below illuminated mirror above, low-level WC with concealed cistern and pushbutton flush, vanity shelf area with cupboards below, chrome radiator/towel rail, tiled walls and flooring with underfloor heating, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, LED ceiling downlights, extractor fan. Garden Irregular shape garden wider than average approximately 60‘ x 40‘with large patio area and side access as well as rear, mainly laid to lawn with mature well maintained flower and shrub borders, garden shed, multiple outside lights and sockets, further patio area leading to large insulated brick built workshop/office. Outbuilding Brick built insulated workshop which could easily become a home office or gym, ample power and light. Driveway providing off street parking for several cars, outside sockets. The vendor has informed us the boiler is approximately one year old and all electrics and heating were renewed within the last 10 years. Front Brochures Lime Close, Carshalton Brochure

bullet_points: Stunning Semi Detached Family Home;Three/Four Bedrooms;Open Plan Kitchen Dining Room;Two Separate Reception Rooms;Modern Family Bathroom And Additional Shower Room;Further Extension Potential STPP;Landscaped Front And Rear Garden;Viewing By Appointment Only
long_description: The Personal Agent are extremely delighted to welcome to the market this stunning three/four bedroom semi detached family home set with a popular and sought after residential road within the Stoneleigh Worcester Park Area. The property itself boasts a welcoming entrance hallway which offers access to two formal reception rooms on to the front of the home one to the rear, a bright and open plan kitchen dining room again to the rear of the property, a great and very handle separate utility room and downstairs shower room along and the ground floor is completed with a double bedroom back to the front of the home. The first floor boasts three additional well proportioned bedrooms, a modern family bathroom and loft access. The property goes on to offer a private and landscaped rear garden with the great addition of a private workshop which has power and lighting directly to it, off street parking to the front for multiple cars and further extension potential to the loft, side and or rear all subject to planning permission. With so much to offer we really do recommend your earliest viewing to avoid missing out on a property sure to have high levels of interest. Worcester Park offers a larger choice of amenities including a Waitrose, banks/building societies and other essential stores, as well as a variety of restaurants, Worcester Park also offers great access to public transport.  The property is within walking distance of both Stoneleigh and Worcester Park mainline rail stations with regular services to London and both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible, giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports, making this property ideal for a commuter too. Tenure - Freehold Council tax band - E Brochures Lynwood Drive, Worcester Park Brochure

On arrival a secure entry phone system lets you into a neat foyer where a well maintained staircase leads you to the apartment. An airy, well lit entrance hall with ample space for jackets and shoes greets you. To your left a shower room with plenty of Wow factor makes a favourable impression. From gorgeous green metro tiles and a super sized shower to the underfloor heating and heated towel rail this shower room aims to please! The very modern open plan kitchen/living room lends a sophisticated feel to the apartment. Built to a high standard, the quality of the kitchen units and appliances is evident.  Both spacious double bedrooms are neutrally presented with wooden floors and lovely bespoke built-in cupboards. The apartment comes with one allocated parking bay. There is space for additional  off street parking behind the building as well as on the street. Additional storage in the form of outside sheds is available for those that need additional space. .  This is not just another flat in a huge block of flats, this is a beautifully maintained apartment in a well maintained apartment block. Situated perfectly with excellent transport links, schools, shops and entertainment. Please take some time to study our 2D and 3D floor plans and to browse through our photographs. This beautiful apartment is sure to sell quickly so book now to avoid disappointment! bullet_points: * Retirement apartment;* Two double bedrooms;* Lift access;* Over 60's only;* Communal gardens & residents parking;* Residents lounge;* Assisted living;* No onward chain;* Buyers Commission May Be Required
long_description: The ever-so popular Hampton Lodge is the perfect place to enjoy a peaceful and convenient lifestyle if you are over 60. Set in Sutton town centre this second (top) floor apartment with lift access is extremely spacious and bright. The apartment comprises two double bedrooms, the main bedroom has built in wardrobes and the second room is a great space for a study / hobby room. The reception room is a really good size meaning it’s a lovely space to relax and unwind or if you like to entertain then you can certainly get a dining table as well as your sofas in there. The kitchen is fully equipped with plenty of storage cupboards. Furthermore, the apartment has a good sized shower room with a sink basin and WC and plenty of storage throughout the rest of the home. The property is in a fair condition and also ideal to mark your own stamp and really make it your own. Hampton Lodge offers residents parking and has stunning communal gardens meaning on those summer months you can sit outside and soak up the sun whilst in a peaceful setting. It also has a residents lounge where the residents can get together for a tipple of their choice or a cup of tea and catch up or play games. There is a guest suite that residents can hire for any visiting guests at a cost of £20.00 per night for one guest or £25.00 for two. This facility is also available for residents to hire across 150 retirement lodges throughout the UK. There is a Lodge manager on site throughout the day who is more than happy to help and assist residents. There is also 24 hour emergency care available via the Careline Response System should you ever need it. There is also a laundrette on site. Hampton Lodge is managed by the award winning Millstream Management Services. bullet_points: Quiet Residential Road In A Highly Sought-After Area;Ample Storage Throughout ;Driveway Parking & Free On-Street Parking ;Stunning Four Bedroom Home;Excellent Transport Links & Schools ;Abundance Of Light & Space Throughout;Fantastic Local Green Spaces ;Viewings 7 Days A Week Including Bank Holidays!
long_description: Laurels are thrilled to present this wonderful semi-detached, four bedroom home to the market, situated in the highly sought-after area of Wallington. This property is moments away from stunning open green spaces, great transport links and local amenities, as well as a number of outstanding local schools including Wilsons School.   When entering the property you are greeted by an open and bright hallway with the reception room on your right that offers an abundance of space. In conjunction with the generously sized kitchen, which is newly refurbished, the downstairs of the property is very much the heart of the home. The kitchen is extended and boasts direct access into the lovely and sunny garden. There is also a shower and utility room on the ground floor that offers ample storage.   Upstairs comprises of two double bedrooms, one with an en-suite shower room, as well as a family bathroom and separate toilet. Continuing up to the second floor of the property there are a further two bedrooms, one of which could be used as a home office or playroom if required, as well as plenty of eaves storage.    Further benefits include a driveway for off-street parking, as well as free on-street parking, superb transport links with a number of bus routes close by, as well as much more. The property has a tax band of 'E' and the local authority is Sutton. Early viewings are highly recommended so as not to miss out on this fantastic home. The EPC is to follow. Brochures Full Details

DESCRIPTION A most spacious and attractive three bedroom detached period family home set in a popular & ultra-convenient location This super house enjoys extremely generous and versatile living space, There is a really pretty rear garden, an attached garage and driveway to the front. The property is located just 1/3rd  mile of Worcester Park's mainline station & town centre. Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to Waterloo in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both London's Airports. Bus services run to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes, there are also direct bus links to Heathrow Airport. The attractive & bustling High Street enjoys a host of familiar brands including: Waitrose, Sainsburys, Pizza Express, Nandos, Costa, Caffe Nero, Starbucks, Boots, WH Smiths & Superdrug, as well as an array of independents.There is a broad selection of pubs & bars and of eateries to satisfy most culinary requests. Young families are attracted to the area's plethora of high performing schools and no less than seven parks. 1. bullet_points: Spacious studio apartment;No onward chain;Share of freehold;Allocated parking;First floor;Coveted block and location;Large reception/bedroom;Fantastic position for amenities and transport links
long_description: Positioned within in an extremely prominent and coveted position in South Sutton, this spacious first floor Studio apartment offers just so much in this price range. It really is a fantastic opportunity for you to move into what may be your first home, or even rent out if you are looking for that rock-solid investment.  What's more, the property is offered with no onward chain and in good condition inside, with a spacious, separate kitchen that has a fabulous amount of workspace for you to really cook up a storm in!  These generous sizes are consistent throughout, with a fantastic bedroom area with integrated wardrobes. The reception area has ample space for you to not just relax in and catch up on a good book or some great TV, but also prefect for you to have your friends and family come over and entertain in, as the room can easily accommodate not just a living area but also a space to dine in. Being on the first floor, you'll also benefit from fantastic elevated views from the bay window, with all the rooms being served by the bathroom. On the outside, as we mentioned, the location is brilliant. A short walk to fantastic local amenities in Sutton with a fantastic selection of shops, restaurants and bars, with Sutton mainline station whizzing you up to London in well under an hour door to door!  The final piece of the jigsaw comes by the way of a allocated parking, perfect for you not having the issues of having to find a space at the end of a long day, a fantastic benefit for the lucky new owner! long_description: Ivy Gate are proud to present to the market this spacious two bedroom two bath/shower room apartment situated within the highly desirable and prestigious Hamptons development. Virtual Tour available to view. The property is located on the ground floor of a purpose built block and benefits from a private veranda/terrace with far reaching views over the Parklands. Upon entering the property there is a spacious hallway with plenty of built in storage. The large open plan kitchen/living room is neutrally decorated to a very high standard and has double doors out on to the private veranda, whilst the kitchen has modern integrated appliances including a dishwasher. There are two spacious bedrooms.. Modern family bathroom/W.C with shower over bath and additional shower room/W.C The property further benefits from one allocated undercover parking space and secure bike storage. Set within 30 acres of landscaped grounds, the area provides a modern and secure lifestyle and a fantastic community feel, with the added benefits and unlimited use of a gymnasium, tennis courts, children's play area, a communal hall that can be reserved for parties and the Mayflower Park which includes a grass amphitheatre for performances. For the commuter, the A3 is a mere 5 minute drive away providing direct links to Central London. Worcester Park railway station is a 10 minute walk away and offers a convenient route to Waterloo in only 25 minutes. There is the added bonus of having the M25 just a 20 min drive away, which opens the door to travel throughout the UK. Brochures Full Details

Situated in a highly sought after residential, wide tree lined road in the centre of Carshalton Beeches is this attractive four bedroom detached property set on a large plot with garage to side and long garden.  Rarely available this imposing property is approached via the carriage driveway and the arts and crafts front door leads to a spacious hallway.  The large double aspect 22ft lounge is bright and airy as is the dining room and the kitchen is also an excellent size.  The ground floor is serviced by a modern cloakroom and the lovely staircase leads to a spacious bright landing with stained glass window.  Upstairs the master bedroom benefits from an ensuite shower room and the three large remaining bedrooms have use of the large four piece modern bathroom. The large garden is spectacular and beautifully maintained with many flower beds and paths.  Whilst the property is a great size, it still lends itself to further development and plans have been drawn up with planning permission already applied for.  See link below for more details: -    The property is also within easy reach of all nearby amenities as well as the usual good schools in the area. Council Tax Band G Accommodation  - Arts and craft wooden front door to… Entrance Hall Wooden flooring, picture/plate rail, large understairs cupboard, further smaller understairs cupboard, radiator cover, ceiling coving, UPVC double glazed leaded light window to front aspect, doors to lounge, dining room, kitchen and cloakroom. Lounge Double aspect room with UPVC windows to front and rear and French doors leading to garden, feature marble fireplace with matching hearth and coal fire insert, wooden flooring, ceiling and wall lights, two radiators. Dining room Double aspect room with windows to side and rear and French doors leading to garden, wooden flooring, ceiling coving and picture rail, radiator cover, serving hatch to kitchen. Kitchen Granite work surfaces with wooden drawers and cupboards below, matching wall units with under lighting, stainless steel Franke under sink with modern chrome mixer tap, stainless steel undercounter double oven, five ring stainless steel gas hob and stainless steel cooker hood above,  space for American style fridge freezer, integrated dishwasher, double aspect room with UPVC double glazed windows to rear and side as well as matching back door to side access/garden. Cloakroom/downstairs WC Low-level WC with push button flush, vanity wash handbasin with modern chrome mixer tap, tiled walls with wooden flooring, ceiling coving and ceiling down light, chrome radiator/towel rail. Stairs to 1st Floor Landing UPVC double glazed leaded light window to front aspect, double storage cupboard/wardrobe space inside currently being used as office area as it’s quite large. Access to loft, ceiling coving, large airing cupboard housing hot water tank with immersion heater for back up hot water, radiator. Bedroom one Double aspect room with UPVC double glazed windows to side and rear, radiator, door to… Ensuite Shower Room Tiled shower enclosure with chrome shower fittings, vanity wash hand basin with modern chrome mixer tap and cupboards below, fitted mirrored medicine cabinet with shelving to sides and lighting, low-level WC, wall mounted chrome radiator/towel rail, tiled flooring and part tiled walls with feature mosaic borders. Bedroom Two UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, ceiling coving, radiator. Bedroom Three  Double aspect room with UPVC double glazed windows to side and rear, ceiling coving, radiator. Bedroom four Double aspect room with UPVC leaded light double glazed window to front and side aspect, ceiling coving, radiator. Bathroom Modern white four piece suite comprising tile enclosed double ended bath with wall mounted three-piece chrome tap set, Shower enclosure with chrome shower fittings, two wash hand basins with matching modern chrome mixer tap and cupboards below, low-level WC with push button flush, tiled walls with feature mosaic border design and tiled flooring, ceiling downlights, extractor fan, double aspect room with UPVC double glazed leaded light windows to front and side, chrome radiator/towel rail. Garden Approximately 110ft in length set on a wide plot. Mainly laid to lawn with mature well maintained flower and shrub borders with mature trees and conifers, summerhouse and various garden sheds as well as vegetable patch, large patio area.  Side Access Large double cupboard currently used as utility area with space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer.  Garage/Outbuilding Divided into two parts with the being used currently a storage and a gym and would easily convert into a home office, window to rear aspect, with door to… Garage Accessed via electric up and over door, power and light, wall mounted electric fuse board and gas and electric metres. long_description: *** Open Day Saturday 18th June by appointment only *** Wandle Road is situated in Beddington which is within the London borough of Sutton and has the river Wandle running along close by. The property is located within distance to local amenities and has the added benefit of only being 0.6 miles from ASDA Beddington Lane plus 0.6 miles of the historic and picturesque Beddington Park. The property is also within 1 mile of Waddon Leisure Centre and just 0.9 miles of Waddon Mainline Station plus with good schools locally including Beddington Park Primary school which is just 0.4 miles and Wilsons School for boys is located 0.8 miles and Beddington Infants 0.9 miles. A great opportunity to purchase this end of terrace family home located on a no through road. Upon entering this property, you are greeted with a square shaped entrance area offering space to sit and take off your shoes after a long day. The property offers two bedrooms the largest measuring 13'1 x 9'10 with built in wardrobes, shower room, reception room with built in base units into alcoves measuring 13'1 x 9'11 that leads into Dining room that measures 12'11 x 8'8, kitchen measuring 11'8 x 6'6 with wall and base units with access onto rear garden. Garden mostly paved with double gates giving access to garage. This property is not one to missed, call now to secure your viewing time.

A beautifully presented 3 double bedroom detached family home, situated in a popular tree lined road in Carshalton on the Hill. Ideally positioned for good local schools, with Stanley Park Junior, Bandon Hill Junior and Oaks Park High School all within easy walking distance. There are also good transport links, with easy access to several bus routes, and local shops also nearby.  This lovely property is full of character throughout and offers spacious accommodation including a fantastic open plan kitchen dining room, a downstairs cloakroom, and two reception rooms. Upstairs there are three well proportioned bedrooms and a luxury modern bathroom. The rear garden has been beautifully landscaped with two patio areas, mature shrubs and flowers and a large level lawn area. Accommodation  - Sheltered entrance, part glazed composite door into Entrance Hall Coved ceiling, panelled radiators, alarm panel, oak wood flooring.  Downstairs Cloakroom Coved ceiling, panelled radiator, oak wood flooring, pedestal wash hand basin with Victorian style chrome taps, low-level WC, extractor fan, UPVC double glazed obscured window to side aspect. Lounge Victorian style feature fireplace with stone mantelpiece and tiled hearth, coved ceiling, dado rail, panelled radiator, oak wood flooring, UPVC double glazed bay window to front aspect, double glazed window to side aspect. Family Room Coved ceiling, panelled radiator, varnished floorboards, ornate feature fireplace with stone mantlepiece, UPVC double glazed bay window to front aspect. Open plan Kitchen Dining Room Kitchen Area Granite worksurface with drawers and cupboards below, matching wall units above, inset butler sink with Victorian style taps, space for range cooker with chrome extractor hood above, space and plumbing for dishwasher and washing machine, integrated fridge freezer, Metro tiled splashback, oak wood flooring, under stairs storage cupboard, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect. Dining Area Log burner with brick fireplace, three 'Velux' windows, under stairs cupboard, panelled radiators, oak wood flooring, UPVC double glazed windows to side and rear aspect, French door leading out to patio area and garden.  Stairs to 1st floor hallway, UPVC double glazed window to rear aspect, loft access with pulldown ladder.  Bedroom One Coved ceiling, panelled radiator, varnished floorboards, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect. Bedroom Two Coved ceiling, panelled radiator, varnished floorboards, UPVC double glazed window to front aspect. Bedroom Three Coved ceiling, panelled radiator, varnished floorboards, UPVC doubled glaze window to rear and side aspect.  Bathroom Freestanding bath with chrome mixer tap and hand shower attachment,  walk in shower cubicle with 'Aqualisa' shower, wall mounted vanity wash hand basin with chrome mixer tap and storage below, low-level pushbutton flush WC, heated chrome towel rails, part tiled walls, extractor fan, tiled floor, UPVC double glazed obscured window to side and rear aspect.  Outside To the front Block paved driveway with off street parking for 2 to 3 cars, gate for side access, lawn area with mature shrubs.  Rear Garden Beautifully maintained and landscaped garden mainly laid to lawn and borders with mature shrubs and flowers, apple trees, fig tree and raspberry bush, Indian sandstone patio with flowerbeds, rear paved patio area with summer house and garden shed, gate for side access, outside tap, outside light. bullet_points: Convenient location;Good size lounge;Utility room;Downstairs cloakroom;Two bedrooms;Family bathroom;Off road parking with electric charging point;Garden;Fully boarded loft space
long_description: Cromwells are pleased to present this delightful two bedroom family home situated in a sought after location close to all local amenities. Both Cheam Village and Sutton Town Centre are close by, offering a variety of shops, restaurants, gyms and transport links. West Sutton main line railway station with excellent links to Central London is within walking distance. Several well regarded local schools are also close by. Accommodation An enclosed newly refurbished porch leads to the front door and on to a good size lounge and fitted kitchen with new shaker style cupboards and butlers sink which overlooking the rear garden. A utility room and downstairs cloakroom complete the ground floor accommodation. Upstairs the landing leads to two good size bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. The loft is fully boarded for extra storage. Outside There is a front driveway for off road parking, complete with an electric charging point. The rear garden extends to approximately 95 ft with a spacious patio area for a table and chairs and BBQ. Established flower beds and shrubs border the garden, with a shed at the rear and additional seating area too. Brochures Property Brochure Full Details

long_description: Tenure:  Please confirm if this is a freehold or leasehold property with Henley Homes HENLEY HOMES ESTATE AGENT - Fairfields is a luxuriously prestigious family home with just under 7,700 sq ft of living accommodation, a self-contained one-bedroom annex and a basement cinema room. Set within South Cheam's premier private road, The Drive.  With an impressive, gated driveway to house a multitude of cars, five further garages and with an overall plot size of approximately 2/3 of an acre this family home offers an extensive array of premium features.  The ground floor provides an extremely spacious double aspect lounge, formal dining room, further family room with adjoining conservatory all with doors leading onto the patio and a light and bright kitchen/breakfast/family area, a fully equipped home office and a gym.  The ground floor also provides two useful cloaks cupboards, downstairs cloakroom, and separate utility. The vast solid oak sweeping staircase leads us to the first floor.  The first floor features a wonderful galleried landing with a stunning balcony overlooking the front aspect of the property.  There are five double bedrooms, three with en-suites and two bedrooms benefiting from a modern jack n jill bathroom, the main suite boasting a separate dressing room and luxurious en-suite. The second floor has a vast guest suite with an en-suite and plenty of storage. The impressive rear garden has a full width patio leading to a wonderful lawn with designer trees and shrubs, a heated Breeze house and an orchard at the rear. bullet_points: Open Day: Saturday 25th June - By Appointment Only;No Onward Chain;Five Bedrooms;Set Over Three Floors;Beautifully Presented;Generous Sizes Throughout;Central Wallington Location;Rear Garden;Double Garage
long_description: **Open Day: Saturday 25th June - By Appointment Only** Wallington is known for its many reputable schools, making this area very popular for family buyers - with this particular property being within just 0.8 miles of Wilson’s School and only 0.7 miles from both Wallington County Grammar School and High View Primary. Situated in a desirable tree lined residential road in the heart of Wallington, this enviably located property is within only 0.8 miles of Wallington High Street with its eclectic mix of restaurants, shops, leisure facilities and various transport links, including Mainline Station - making it ideal for commuters. We believe that upon entering this extended five bedroom semi-detached family home, you’ll be immediately impressed with the generous sizes and flawless finish this bright and spacious property boasts. Set over three floors, this imposing and impeccable family home consists of a welcoming entrance hall with access to a 13’3 x 6’8 study, a fully tiled shower room, well-appointed 15’3 x 11’7 kitchen, an elegant 14’10 x 12’11 living room which opens into a sizeable 13’11 x 12’9 dining room, both benefitting from beautiful Chesney fireplaces - and then finishing off the ground floor of this extraordinary property is a truly impressive 19’3 x 9’2 conservatory – allowing the natural light to come flooding through. The upper floors of this cavernous semi-detached house are also sure to not disappoint, with the first floor offering a sleek and stylish family bathroom and then four very well proportioned bedrooms – the largest measuring 15’5 x 12’9 and with three of them having the added benefit of fitted cupboards - and then located on the second floor is the exceptional 23’2 x 17’5 main bedroom - currently being used as a sitting room - which we believe is the jewel in this appealing family homes crown! Externally, this captivating property boasts off street parking to the front, a beautifully maintained ‘L’ shaped 57’5 x 30’5 rear garden with an immaculate oyster slate paved patio area and then a 20’4 x 18’7 double garage with electric doors which has been designed for versatile usage. We highly recommend a viewing of this exquisite family home to fully appreciate everything it has to offer, as it really is a testament to the current owners taste and vision. Brochures Particulars

Hallways are pleased to market this attractive property in the peaceful location of Briar Lane, Carshalton.   Set back from the road, this property has a lovely frontage and a charming appeal.  Offering generous and versatile accommodation, this much-loved home will suit your growing family for a range of needs.  The choice of family areas on both floors means that you can enjoy time together or get some space for peace and quiet. A very pretty house in a high-demand school catchment area and a very popular location.  Surrounded by some of Surrey's finest open green belt countryside for walks, golf courses, and equestrian activities look no further for a home that gives you a range of recreational features on your doorstep.  The property is located on a quiet residential road in South Wallington Easy reach of Wallington & Purley Town centres with a choice of stations linking you to London Bridge or London Victoria within approx 20 mins. Grammar schools are very close by, as well as a selection of state and private schools. Wallington Girls - walking distance, Wilsons, John Fisher Wallington Grammar, Cumnor House, Whitgift School, and Croydon High for Girls, all within a short distance.  Wallington has great amenities, shops, restaurants, and cafes. Also a great selection of nearby sports centres including David Lloyd, Westcroft or Purley Sports Club for swimming, tennis, and cricket.   M25, M23, Gatwick, and Heathrow Airports, make this a very easy commute to town or to the coast. VENDORS COMMENTS:  'When we first drove to see the property we felt as though we were in the countryside.  Such a beautiful home with lovely, peaceful walks right on the doorstep.  We loved the fact that for a family of five we all had a place to go and have time to ourselves.  The garden has been an absolute joy with an abundance of bird life and a wonderful view of the small holding and farming fields. VIEWING BY APPOINTMENT ONLY Take a tour with our Exclusive 3D VR file and contact   to book your in-person viewing now. Council Tax Band: G (LB Sutton) Tenure: Freehold Brochures Brochure

long_description: SUMMARY A spacious three bedroom end of terrace family home offered to the market with no onward chain. DESCRIPTION A spacious three bedroom end of terrace family home offered to the market with no onward chain. This great property benefits from being beautifully set back from the road with a large driveway and front garden as well as a secluded rear garden. The accommodation offers a great deal of flexibility with two bedrooms and an ensuite shower room upstairs and a further bedroom located on the ground floor with a modern shower room. Worcester Park & North Cheam are located on the borders of Surrey & South West London. Located just 10 miles from Central London, Worcester Park is an ideal destination for commuters, with a direct Zone 4 rail link to London's Waterloo via Clapham Junction & Wimbledon in under 30 minutes and departing every 15 minutes. Worcester Park is located just off the A3, which offers road links to Central London, the M25 and both of London's Gatwick & Heathrow Airports. Local bus services will get you to Morden's Northern Line Station in approx. 15 minutes. Auctioneer's Comments   This property is offered through Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid your data will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited.  This method requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days, allowing buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey). The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee of 4.2% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. This fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to complete an identification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.  The property has a Buyer Information Pack containing documents about the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know, so you must complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are contained within this pack. The buyer will also make payment of £300 inc VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack. The estate agent and auctioneer may recommend the services of other providers to you, in which they will be paid for the referral. These services are optional, and you will be advised of any payment, in writing before any services are accepted. Listing is subject to a start price and undisclosed reserve price that can change. 1. MONEY LAUNDERING REGULATIONS: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale. 2. long_description: ** Launch Day - Saturday 25th June ** This beautifully presented four/five bedroom, semi-detached bungalow is set within one of Worcester Park’s most sought after roads and conveniently located for Worcester Park high street and mainline rail station. The area has much to offer including open parkland at the historic Nonsuch Park and a well-stocked high street with abundance of shops, restaurants and bars.  Numerous well-regarded schools are close by including Cheam Common Infant’s Academy and Nonsuch High School for Girls.  The property has been extended throughout to create a superb family home and accommodation now includes three well-proportioned reception rooms, one of which was originally classed as the Principal bedroom and could be easily used as the fifth bedroom, a modern fitted kitchen, a family bathroom, four good sized bedrooms and a further shower room/WC. There is also plenty of wardrobe space and storage within the eaves.   Outside, the landscaped rear garden extends to around 55 feet and provides the perfect space for socialising and relaxation. Whilst to the front of the property, the driveway offers ample off street parking. Brochures Web Details Particulars

bullet_points: Three Bedroom Terraced House;Ideal Investment Property;Two Bathrooms;Partially Modernised;Rear Courtyard Garden;Two Reception Rooms;Timber Storage Shed;Chain Free
long_description: An ideal investment opportunity or perhaps the perfect first family home; this fantastic three bedroom Victorian terrace property is offered * CHAIN FREE * and includes a private, substantial courtyard garden whilst being within easy reach of nearby amenities and travel links. This excellent property briefly comprises a generous entrance hallway, two reception rooms, two bathrooms, a separate kitchen and three good sized bedrooms, alongside being conveniently located within walking distance to local outstanding schools such as Robinhood primary and Westbourne primary schools. In addition, the property is within easy access of local amenities including Sutton town centre, West Sutton and Sutton train stations. An ideal investment opportunity or perhaps the perfect first family home; this fantastic three bedroom Victorian terrace property is offered * CHAIN FREE * and includes a private, substantial courtyard garden whilst being within easy reach of nearby amenities and travel links. This excellent property briefly comprises a generous entrance hallway, two reception rooms, two bathrooms, a separate kitchen and three good sized bedrooms, alongside being conveniently located within walking distance to local outstanding schools such as Robinhood primary and Westbourne primary schools. In addition, the property is within easy access of local amenities including Sutton town centre, West Sutton and Sutton train stations. INTERIOR GROUND FLOOR Set back from the path by a small, paved front garden, bordered by a low brick wall - the property is accessed through a front door opening directly into a reception hallway. From here, stairs rise to the first floor landing, whilst an internal door on the far left hand side provides access to the living room and adjoining dining area, leading through to another internal hallway offering further access to the downstairs bathroom and generous kitchen. Kitchen: 8'11" x 7'1" - 8'2" x 6'9" / (2.71m x 2.17m) - (2.50m x 2.07m) To the rear of the property can be found a substantial kitchen, offering access to the courtyard through patio doors. The kitchen is laid to original, solid wood flooring and features an integrated electric oven with four ring gas hob and overhead extractor, integrated fridge/freezer, stainless steel sink/drainer with chrome mixer tap. Benefiting from a selection of wall and base units to two sides, the kitchen also includes a washing machine, wall mounted radiator, recessed LED spotlights, in addition to housing the property's boiler. With some simple adjustments the kitchen could accommodate a dining table and chairs, presenting opportunity for the dining room to be used as a playroom, study or even occasional bedroom if required.  Adjacent to the kitchen is a downstairs bathroom. Bathroom:  The fully tiled downstairs bathroom has been recently modernised to include a WC with concealed cistern and storage surround, bath with overhead shower, chrome towel radiator, frosted glass window allowing for natural light whilst maintaining privacy and wall mounted illuminated mirror. Dining Area: 14'5" x 11'11" (4.40m x 3.62m) leading to Living Room: 11'4" x 11'1" (3.46m x 3.39m) Towards the front of the property can be found an adjoining dining room and living room. Originally two reception rooms which have been knocked through to create a beautifully light and airy open plan space; both the living and dining spaces have been laid to wood laminate flooring, include wall mounted radiators, original picture rails and enjoy double aspect views out to the front and rear.  The living room features a beautiful, decommissioned fireplace with decorate surround, marble hearth and mantle.  FIRST FLOOR Stairs rise from the ground floor reception hall to a landing space offering access to the property's three bedrooms and second bathroom. Bedroom 1: 14'5" x 10'4" (4.40m x 3.15m) Overlooking the front of the property and featuring fitted wardrobes offering generous amounts of storage, bedroom 1 is fully carpeted and includes a wall mounted radiator. Bedroom 2: 11'11" x 8'11" (3.64m x 2.71m) Another good sized double bedroom, bedroom 2 overlooks the rear garden, includes a wall mounted radiator, built in wardrobe, and is laid to wood laminate flooring. Bedroom 3: 9'4" x 8'11" (2.85m x 2.71) Overlooking the rear courtyard garden, bedroom 3 also includes a fitted wardrobe, is laid to wood laminate flooring and benefits from a wall mounted radiator. This room would make an ideal childrens bedroom, nursery or study if required. Bathroom: 6'1" x 5'9" (1.85m x 1.75m) The partially tiled first floor bathroom includes a WC, bath with overhead shower, frosted glass window, pedestal wash hand basin and wall mounted medicine cabinet.  EXTERIOR To the rear of the property can be found a spacious, south facing courtyard garden which, laid with timber decking, is accessed directly from the kitchen and has potential as a superb entertaining space for family and friends. The garden includes a timber storage shed, outdoor tap and gated access to the rear lane.  DISCLAIMER These particulars are intended to give a fair description of the property but their accuracy cannot be guaranteed and they do not constitute an offer of contract. Intending purchasers must rely on their own inspection of the property. None of the above appliances/services have been tested by eSale. We recommend purchasers arrange for a qualified person to check all appliances/services before making any legal commitment. Brochures Collingwood Road, Sutton Brochure

Through the lounge you have a separate kitchen with breakfast area which is light and airy and leads out to the rear patio garden.   As well as your private patio garden you also have access to communal gardens at the rear of the property. The garage is attached to the back and has plenty of room to park a car as well as having room for storage space and/or a work bench.   On the first floor there are two good sized double bedrooms, one single bedroom and a modern bathroom, with P shaped bath and shower over the bath.   Benefits include double glazing, gas central heating, plenty of storage space, garage, private garden areas to the front and rear and off street parking.   Gander Green Lane is very popular with both families and investors due to its close proximity to green spaces, local shops, transport links (to Sutton, Cheam, Raynes Park, and Morden) and well regarded schools. long_description: Complete are delighted to market this beautifully presented one bedroom apartment in the highly sought after Tavernelle House development, Sutton, SM1. Located on the 3rd floor of this fantastic development, this one-bedroom/one-bathroom property provides 631 square feet of open plan living space. The bedroom is spacious with allocated storage space, and is also carpeted for your comfort. The open plan kitchen/living area is fully applianced with top of the range Electrolux electric fan oven, electric hob, under counter fridge with a freezer box, slim-line dishwasher, and washer/dryer.  Our favourite features of the development are the roof top gardens available to all residents and the private balconies accessible via the living rooms, allowing maximum natural light to embrace the property. The units also provide you with excellent storage space in the hallways, and modern bathrooms.  Sutton is the principal town of the Borough of Sutton in Surrey, England. It lies on the lower slopes of the North Downs. It is one of the eleven metropolitan centres identified in the London Plan.  Sutton has a theatre, the largest library in the borough, several works of public art, four conservation areas and a park and green at either end of the high street. Sutton station is the largest in the borough, with frequent services to central London among other destinations. Sutton is home to the Royal Marsden Hospital. The local authority is Sutton London Borough Council. Its principal town is the eponymous Sutton. Sutton has a village feel with its array of parks out greenery. The high street has a variety of shops and restaurants making it ideal for family and young professionals alike.   Service Charge: £1432.84pa Ground Rent: £425.00pa Lease: 243 remaining

long_description: This two bedroom, first floor maisonette comes with 933 years remaining on the lease. North Cheam High Street offers many shops, restaurants, local transport links, parks and some outstanding local schools. As you enter the maisonette the master bedroom is on the right hand side and has a front aspect, double glazed bay window.   The reception room has double glazed duel aspect windows, laminate wood flooring, lighting and a radiator.    There is a kitchen which has a side aspect double glazed window, built in gas hob and electric oven along with overhead extractor fan.  There are laminated work top surfaces, wall and base units provide storage and there is plumbing for a washing machine.     Bedroom 1 measures 13’1 x 10'7, is front aspect with a double glazed angular bay window, radiator and laminated flooring.    Bedroom 2 measures 10'5 x 10'  also has a rear aspect double glazed window, radiator and laminate flooring.      The bathroom is part tiled and comprises of a pan bath, sink unit, low level WC, wall mounted radiator and a side aspect obscured glass double glazed window.     A huge benefit with this maisonette is your own rear garden. The Garden is approached via the side of the property.     LOCATION     This property is located just off the London Road so ideally placed for Local Shops and bus routes. The 93 bus runs from the London Road through to Morden Underground which is on the Northern line. Stay on the bus and it will take you to Wimbledon and Putney High Streets.  North Cheam offers many diverse shops, restaurants and Sainsbury's Superstore along with other bus routes to Cheam, Epsom and Sutton. long_description: The Personal Agent are extremely delighted to welcome to the market this three bedroom terraced and extended family home set within a popular and sought after residential road within the Stoneleigh/Worcester Park area. The property itself boast a three spacious and well proportioned bedrooms, bright and open reception room stretching from the front to the back of the property, an extended and modern kitchen and a modern family bathroom. The property goes on to offer a private and landscaped rear garden along with a private front garden and access to insulated loft which could potentially go on to be extended into STPP. With so much to offer we really do recommend your earliest viewing to avoid missing out on a property sure to have high levels of interest. Worcester Park offers a larger choice of amenities including a Waitrose, banks/building societies and other essential stores, as well as a variety of restaurants, Worcester Park also offers great access to public transport.  The property is within walking distance of Worcester Park mainline rail station with regular services to London and both the M25 and A3 are easily accessible, giving a straight forward route to London and both Heathrow and Gatwick international airports.  There are also local bus routes nearby giving convenient access to Morden underground making this property ideal for commuters. Tenure - Freehold Brochures Shrubland Grove, Worcester Park Brochure

bullet_points: Executive Family Home;Five Double Bedrooms;Three Bathrooms;Five Reception Rooms;1/3 Acre South Facing Garden;Over 3,800 Sq. Ft;Spacious Garage;Carriage Driveway;Potential for Self Contained Annex;South Cheam
long_description: A substantial and very attractive EXECUTIVE FAMILY HOME offering in excess of 3,800 SQ. FT of bright accommodation. This spacious property provides five double bedrooms, five reception rooms and a south facing 1/3 ACRE (approx.) GARDEN. Located within the highly sought after SOUTH side of Cheam village. The ground floor of this beautifully presented family home offers spacious and versatile living accommodation. There is a useful porch and welcoming entrance hallway with cloakroom, off of which is a bright formal living room, a study, and a family room with charming bay window. There is a lovely orangery with views of the mature garden. The kitchen / breakfast room sits centrally in the house and offers high quality units, work surfaces and built in appliances. The kitchen also provides a central island and ample space for a table and chairs. From the kitchen, the left wing of the house offers the potential for a self contained annex and currently provides a gym / studio, a large utility room (which could be used as a kitchen) and a WC. A turning staircase leads to the spacious first floor landing and five bright double bedrooms including the master suite with a modern en-suite shower room, bedroom two with en-suite shower room, a three piece family bathroom and a separate WC. The outstanding and expansive rear garden is approximately 1/3 of an acre, mature and beautifully manicured. The garden is mainly laid to lawn, surrounded by high trees and hedging and offers a number of patioed seating areas. To the front, the carriage driveway offers parking for several vehicles and leads to an integral garage with ample room for a car in addition to bike / storage space. High View is a sought after tree lined road with a range of impressive detached homes. Nearby Cheam village offers an excellent selection of independent shops, restaurants and cafes. Cheam station provides trains to London Bridge and Victoria in approximately 30 minutes. Brochures HIGH VIEW, CHEAM

bullet_points: Beautiful, modern design ;Brasserie & bar, fitness suite & club lounge on site;Private balcony/terrace;Landscaped outdoor terraces;Video door entry system;On-site call system;24-hour on-site staff presence;A vibrant community exclusively for over 65;Just a stone's throw away, shops, cafes , restaurants, doctors, pharmacy and more;Within Zone 4 - London Victoria is 25 mins direct;1 & 2 bedroom apartments ;Open green space is just a few minutes walk away at Beddington Park ;80 stylish apartments;Central London just a 23-minute train journey away;Independant Living in a Retirement Community;Now Open For Viewings;Full Purchase or Part Buy Available (ask for further details);Ideal Location for Shops & Parks;Range of Amenities On Your Doorstep;24hr On Site Support Team For Your Peace Of Mind
long_description: Tenure:  Leasehold, 250 years remaining Our Button House community features 80 beautifully designed one and two-bedroom apartments, each offering everything you need to live life to the full during your retirement.  This modern home features a large, open plan kitchen and living/dining area leading to a private balcony, a well-sized bedroom with en-suite bathroom, plus plenty of storage space and natural light.  The Hub is at the heart of the community at Button house. Here, you can take part in a range of events and activities, from wine or whisky tasting to gardening club, cookery classes and much more. Daily exercise and wellbeing classes take place in the fitness suite, including yoga and Pilates, plus you can enjoy unlimited use of the fitness equipment. The hobby room and club lounge offer a space to relax with friends and family or discover a new hobby. Plus, the onsite Slate & Grain brasserie and bar offers the perfect place to bring loved ones together over good food, good drink, and conversation.  Feeling part of a community undoubtedly makes life more meaningful and enjoyable. Button House is a community in its own right, however great care has been taken to choose a location where you will feel part of the wider community.   Shops, places to eat and drink and other amenities such as health centres and pharmacies, can all be found close by. Plus, the beautiful rolling green space at Beddington Park, where the River Wandle runs, is just a short walk away.   A couple of miles up the road is neighbouring Sutton which has two indoor shopping centres, a bustling high street, Sutton's library, and all the main supermarkets. It's also home to the renowned Royal Marsden Hospital and a satellite of the Moorfields Eye Hospital. For those who love getting into the city - the centre of London is only 25 minutes away by train and if travelling abroad, Gatwick airport is a convenient 17 miles away.  Discreet care can be provided by our trusted care provider (registered with the Care Quality Commission). We also offer a range of lifestyle support services. Charges apply for these services.   All homes are available to rent, buy or part buy, part buy.  Please note that service charges* apply to prices shown. Please get in touch with a member of the Brio team for further information on what this fee covers.   * Concierge Fees:  A monthly Concierge Fee covers a range of on site facilities and services- please see the brochure for full details.  ** Deferred Management Fee: On reselling the property, owners pay a Deferred Management Fee (DMF) of up to 15% of the property value; an Estate Agency Fee of 1% of the sale price achieved; and an Administration Fee of at least £500.   ***Some photographs may not necessarily be of the specific property for sale.
